commit_message:
Update auth_uri option to www_authenticate_uri

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated in Queens [1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I0f808e84ccacb952d4da22bfb4266c29e79b12a6
(cherry picked from commit 90796cfed9af9f52d840506bc3744c7dd0699f7d)

messages:
[{'account_id': 20560, 'date': '2018-05-08 09:10:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20560, 'date': '2018-05-08 10:03:23.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to openstack/apmec'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-05-08 17:51:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

what about the other two projects? Those need changes as well.

Also, this means you need to add zuul configuration in-tree - is that your intention? Your very first change needs to add the jobs, otherwise you cannot merge anything. This is perfectly fine - just want you to be aware of it.'}, {'account_id': 20560, 'date': '2018-05-08 20:07:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> what about the other two projects? Those need changes as well.

 > otherwise you cannot merge anything. This is perfectly fine - just
 > want you to be aware of it.

Thanks Andreas, I will add two other projects. Regarding zuul jobs, if I understand correctly, I need to migrate legacy jobs to my own repositories.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-05-08 20:08:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

you don't have legacy jobs ;)

You can leave standard jobs like python27 here - but repo specific ones should be in-tree."}, {'account_id': 20560, 'date': '2018-05-08 20:39:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20560, 'date': '2018-05-08 20:41:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Remove "non-voting" from Neuton designate scenario job label

As neutron-tempest-plugin-designate-scenario was switched to be voting
in [1] its label on Neutron's failure rate dashboard is now changed
also.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568681/

Change-Id: I3d92abbfeae7c302ee9f154265be23099ced319f

subject: Add support for listing hosts in cellv2
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 11536, 'name': 'hongbin', 'email': 'hongbin034@gmail.com', 'username': 'hongbin'}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15888, 'name': 'Zhenyu Zheng', 'email': 'zheng.zhenyu@outlook.com', 'username': 'Kevin_Zheng'}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-04-24 00:54:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-04-24 00:56:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So, I posted this right before I read the bug comments and saw Matt's comment about not backporting:

"""Removed pike and ocata from this bug report as potential backport targets since the change on master introduced a versioned object rpc bump which we generally don't backport, and there are options for listing hosts within a cell in pike and ocata, so it's less important there."""

But... Is there any chance this could be made to work? I am not sure what's involved exactly with those versioned objects.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-04-24 01:01:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We're looking into the "alternatives" mentioned. Maybe won't need this.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-24 02:49:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/563797/1/ : SUCCESS in 1h 54m 01s'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-04-24 03:23:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

test failure is valid'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-04-24 03:24:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-04-24 16:46:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-04-26 21:18:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-04-26 21:20:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Of course, I don't really understand these versioned objects so I don't know if that is right at all anyway -- I just fixed the cherry-pick from the original patch"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-27 01:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/563797/2/ : SUCCESS in 2h 52m 07s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-09 14:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

In Pike, you still have the nova-manage host list command:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/pike/nova/cmd/manage.py#L621

So you can run that with your cell-specific --config-file if you want to see hosts in a specific cell. The --config-file passed to the command would have the [database]/connection configured to point at the cell database you want to pull hosts from.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-09 14:15:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Also, see FAQ #1 here:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/user/cells.html#faqs'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-05-16 08:21:07.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

OK, we'll look further into doing it that way. Thanks."}]

commit_message:
Add support for listing hosts in cellv2

Add a ``nova-manage cell_v2 list_hosts`` command for listing hosts
in one or all v2 cells.

Change-Id: Ie8eaa8701aafac10e030568107b8e6255a60434d
Closes-Bug: #1735687
(cherry picked from commit c7b51a63b0c3b5ad80979060bbfe49287e6da847)

subject: Deprecate auth_uri option
messages:
[{'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-05-15 06:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-05-15 10:21:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Why are we backporting this?'}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-05-16 02:45:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Tobias Urdin,
Because the auth_uri option was deprecated and renamed in Queens [1].
This change has been backported on Nova [2] as well.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/blob/stable/queens/releasenotes/notes/rename-auth-uri-d223d883f5898aee.yaml
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/564336'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-05-16 07:35:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

We do not backport deprecations, also this would break Queens installations because the www_authenticate_uri isn't even backported to stable/queens."}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-05-16 08:18:21.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Hi Tobias Urdin,
Thanks for your comment.
This patch will be abandoned then.'}]

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated in Queens [1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: Icdcf8e0b6dc85d40f205cf65a993c4bc93f61d89

(cherry picked from commit fe4fc654f4e45cba0293c94f1b16bfda7d2a7a83)

commit_message:
fix lower-constraints

We cannot modify the requirements list until the existing lower
constraints values are correct.

Change-Id: I8ed238bfcb6e11a0b5e28404ccb93e88e01d83b7

commit_message:
Remove kubetoolbox image from common role

Since the kolla-kubernetes has been separated, and nowhere to
use kubetoolbox, it is safe to remove it from kolla-ansible.

commit_message:
Fix todo that is not needed anymore stestr conf

Stestr conf was using the wrong module name so tox would not work (I
have no idea how that passes tempest gates) So fixing that so tox works
(on an env that has tempest setup) and removed todos that the force
deletion has been merged

Change-Id: Ib47148c5e28acaae7cd5872a1af3e7d044336ea1

commit_message:
Retire carbon jobs for rocky.

This patch remove carbon gate jobs from queue, as the
goal is to run jobs for master branches of both ODL (which
will be fluorine snapshot) and networking-odl.

Change-Id: I05cd2bbaad45d8e475ddfc8766ae1138c1751fe0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-15 19:19:44.000000000', 'message': 'Include both new and deprecated rules in generated sample

Previously, if a deprecated_rule was set on a rule, only the
deprecated rule was written to the sample policy file.  This is
wrong since we want to be setting the new, undeprecated rule going
forward.

Change-Id: I181aeecda686d1d499616254c93002f51a5462c3
'}]
commit_message:
Include both new and deprecated rules in generated sample

Previously, if a deprecated_rule was set on a rule, only the
deprecated rule was written to the sample policy file.  This is
wrong since we want to be setting the new, undeprecated rule going
forward.

Change-Id: I181aeecda686d1d499616254c93002f51a5462c3

> Maybe we should just add the "complex affinity" architecture and the "max_server_per_host" for anti-affinity implementation. As I really cannot think of usecases of "min_server_per_host" for affinity filter. If someone find it useful, maybe they can add it latter, like other possible usecases with the "complex affinity" architecure.

I tend to agree with Kevin. If we're getting caught up in the 'min_server_per_host' + affinity policy design, but no one is really asking for that today, AND we know that we'd need separate limit rules for anti-affinity and affinity policies, then let's just drop the affinity limit from this spec and focus on the max_servers_per_host + anti-affinity case. We can microversion in more rules later if needed, which is nice flexibility in the design proposed here for the rules and per-policy validation here.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-26 14:13:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-03-26 19:07:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'm really not thrilled with this spec. :(

This smells like adding more orchestration functionality to Nova that is like the existing min_instances/max_instances nova boot parameters which have introduced so much headache and technical debt over the years.

This functionality can already be achieved manually by having the MANO/VNFM system create multiple nova host aggregates, one for each physical compute host and manually scheduling up to X number of instances to each host aggregate.

Alternately, use OpenStack to manage the compute host infrastructure, install Kubernetes or Nomad on large VMs (or Ironic baremetal instances) and use k8s or nomad for orchestration (since that is what those systems excel at and are built for).

I'm really not pleased with adding yet more orchestration-level APIs to the compute API.

-jay"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-26 21:23:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

> This smells like adding more orchestration functionality to Nova that is like the existing min_instances/max_instances nova boot parameters which have introduced so much headache and technical debt over the years.

Smells like but isn't really I don't think. This is just building on stuff that already exists (creating multiple servers in a group, and allowing a way to specify anti-affinity limits per host for the members of the group).

> This functionality can already be achieved manually by having the MANO/VNFM system create multiple nova host aggregates, one for each physical compute host and manually scheduling up to X number of instances to each host aggregate.

Sure, you could do that, but then you'll also likely eventually have a mess of host aggregates and managing that is going to be its own problem.

> I'm really not pleased with adding yet more orchestration-level APIs to the compute API.

This isn't a full-blown new API, it's a toggle for a specific server group policy, defaulting to existing behavior.

If you're so opposed to adding orchestration to the compute API based on principle, then I'm surprised you'd be advocating for the compute API to be mirroring host aggregates into Placement:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545057/

Which is also something that people can do completely external to nova."}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-03-27 01:34:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

> Maybe we should just add the "complex affinity" architecture and
 > the "max_server_per_host" for anti-affinity implementation. As I
 > really cannot think of usecases of "min_server_per_host" for
 > affinity filter. If someone find it useful, maybe they can add it
 > latter, like other possible usecases with the "complex affinity"
 > architecure.

Yeah, sure, and we can add min_server_per_host until we really need it, but I think not now.'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-03-27 01:34:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-03-27 01:35:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-03-27 04:39:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

> > This functionality can already be achieved manually by having the
 > MANO/VNFM system create multiple nova host aggregates, one for each
 > physical compute host and manually scheduling up to X number of
 > instances to each host aggregate.
 > 
 > Sure, you could do that, but then you'll also likely eventually
 > have a mess of host aggregates and managing that is going to be its
 > own problem.

More of a mess than the existing server group functionality?

 > > I'm really not pleased with adding yet more orchestration-level
 > APIs to the compute API.
 > 
 > This isn't a full-blown new API, it's a toggle for a specific
 > server group policy, defaulting to existing behavior.
 > 
 > If you're so opposed to adding orchestration to the compute API
 > based on principle, then I'm surprised you'd be advocating for the
 > compute API to be mirroring host aggregates into Placement:
 > 
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545057/

I don't consider that a proxy because I believe the placement API should, long-term, be the thing that stores group information about resource providers (which host aggregates are).

 > Which is also something that people can do completely external to
 > nova.

Agreed.

-jay"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-03-27 04:39:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-03-27 08:42:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)

I can sympathize with both Matt and Jay's positions on this. On the one hand, it is making an existing thing a bit more useful. On the other hand, it is complicating an already complex thing that for which there is newer tooling that could likely do the job better and save everyone some effort.

So doing this is a statement of how much of the stack we think nova should occupy. I tend to think we should (long-term) be working to simplify nova to make it easier and more consistent for use by other orchestrators.

Which I guess means I'm aligned with Jay on this not being an especially desirable feature. However, the spec is well explained and if people want it, cool. So that balance my vote out to an abstain."}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2018-03-27 09:42:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

That looks a good start, but I don't like us discussing about one specific rule for one specific policy while we should be thinking about the impact for the other policies."}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-03-28 01:52:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-03-28 02:21:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 27552, 'date': '2018-03-28 03:16:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-03-29 04:47:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I understand Both Matt and Jay points also. Is there anything we can instead of the server group in the future? not everyone has a MANO system to do that. I heard of a lot of people needs affinity feature, but we don't have anything can instead of server group even we know itis mess."}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-11 07:18:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-11 07:19:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(1 comment)

Thanks for review, :)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-18 19:32:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

I'm OK with the overall direction, but there are some issues which should be cleaned up in the spec."}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-19 02:01:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-19 02:02:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-20 01:32:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2

I'm OK with this now given the limited scope and strong validation in place."}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-05-03 01:23:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Patch Set 16 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-05-15 07:25:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

-1 for the DB model change, it isn't clear what we will store in that column"}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-05-15 08:13:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

Thanks for review, and I will plus the detail db format."}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-05-15 08:16:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-15 12:54:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Still looks OK to me.'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-05-16 06:42:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

commit_message:
Complex (Anti)-Affinity Policies

The scheduler needs to provide some mechanism to control
the last of these by limiting the proportion of a group
of related VMs that are scheduled on the same host.

APIImpact

blueprint: complex-anti-affinity-policies

Change-Id: I2b71f27ce11f21aaa5eb4895c0fa57fb6829a705

commit_message:
Remove LIBS_FROM_GIT as a var in zuul.yaml

As per latest changes in Zuul, there's no need to set LIBS_FROM_GIT
variable manually; instead, we can just specify the project in
`required-projects` and the devstack job will set it up  automatically.

Change-Id: Ib9f506b802f6af914d1d9b37017074dfdcf23d2c

[{'created': '2018-05-15 12:55:31.000000000', 'message': "Add INVENTORY_INUSE to DELETE /rp/{u}/inventories

Change I9a833aa35d474caa35e640bbad6c436a3b16ac5e added a custom error
code framework to the placement API and, as an example of a specific
error code, created INVENTORY_INUSE ('placement.inventory.inuse') for
PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}/inventories.  We have essentially the
same error condition for DELETE /resource_providers/{uuid}/inventories,
so this change set adds the same error code there.

Change-Id: I52715205e607cef5deee1351099725885b282c08
"}]
commit_message:
Add INVENTORY_INUSE to DELETE /rp/{u}/inventories

Change I9a833aa35d474caa35e640bbad6c436a3b16ac5e added a custom error
code framework to the placement API and, as an example of a specific
error code, created INVENTORY_INUSE ('placement.inventory.inuse') for
PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}/inventories.  We have essentially the
same error condition for DELETE /resource_providers/{uuid}/inventories,
so this change set adds the same error code there.

Change-Id: I52715205e607cef5deee1351099725885b282c08

commit_message:
Clarify point of task tracker being used

It wasn't clear in the note why people would care
which tracker is being used by their project.  I
thank adding the note that they should take note of
the small section on Launchpad makes it clearer.

Change-Id: I7360a133db1374b708203adb22c20007f97bbb60

(1 comment)

Thank you for the contribution, James.

These actions should be added to the ceph-mon (the ones executing ceph monitor commands) and ceph-osd (the ones introspecting the filesystem) charms as well.

The actions that are introspecting the filesystem might query out of date information for OSDs that has been removed and are no longer active. You should consider getting the information from the mon or finding some way of verifying that the OSD is actually active before attempting to query it through the filesystem.

I would like to see some unit and functional tests exercising these actions too.

Please see my in-line comments as well.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2017-09-12 16:18:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thank you for your work on this.

As Frode indicated, the ceph-mon and ceph-osd charms are the path forward, and these actions should exist there.  The 'ceph' charm is legacy, and for now there is a bit of double work here admittedly.

Each of the reviews should have the same topic/branch so that they can be tracked and reviewed as a batch.

commit_message:
Add four new actions to the Ceph charm

* list-host-osds - lists mounted OSDs for a given unit
* get-health - outputs ceph -s output
* disk-for-osd - returns the block device backing a given OSD
* osd-for-disk - returns the OSD ID (if any) for a given disk

Including unit tests for the above four actions.

Change-Id: Ic9f27d611c0be4f3056d1360d03f93d4d458ac14
Closes-Bug: #1720099

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-11 21:37:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add force parameter for quota set

If the used or reserved value of compute quotas was greater than
the value being set, then the "quota set" command failed. This adds
the force parameter which is supported by the Nova API. The new
parameter is omitted when setting network or volume quotas since it
is not supported by the respective APIs.

Change-Id: I67347fe677252c242aaa47a11b926123aed21bd8
Closes-Bug: #1738981
'}, {'created': '2018-04-23 06:55:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add force parameter for quota set

If the used or reserved value of compute quotas was greater than
the value being set, then the "quota set" command failed. This adds
the force parameter which is supported by the Nova API. The new
parameter is omitted when setting network or volume quotas since it
is not supported by the respective APIs.

commit_message:
Add force parameter for quota set

If the used or reserved value of compute quotas was greater than
the value being set, then the "quota set" command failed. This adds
the force parameter which is supported by the Nova API. The new
parameter is omitted when setting network or volume quotas since it
is not supported by the respective APIs.

Change-Id: I67347fe677252c242aaa47a11b926123aed21bd8
Story: #2001938
Task: #15052

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-15 11:51:25.000000000', 'message': "placement: Fix HTTP error generation

The traits and the inventories wsgi handler inserted the detailed error
message to the webob.exc.HTTPXXX exceptions via the 'explanation' kwarg.
This caused that the generated error messages does not contain the generic
explanation of the HTTP error code just the passed in explanation text.
The rest of the placement API uses first positional arg of the exception
classes to pass in the extra details. Having this inconsistency makes
really hard to print proper error messages from the osc-placement
plugin.

This patch removes the incosistency by changing the code to use the
positional arg.

The change does not affect nova.scheduler.client.report._RE_INV_IN_USE
regex usage as that regex applied via re.search() and this change only
adds a new sentece to the message.

Change-Id: I196c2e3dabcbf0564c1ca0bd4870dc2df3efc836
Close-Bug: #1771325
"}]
commit_message:
placement: Fix HTTP error generation

The traits and the inventories wsgi handler inserted the detailed error
message to the webob.exc.HTTPXXX exceptions via the 'explanation' kwarg.
This caused that the generated error messages does not contain the generic
explanation of the HTTP error code just the passed in explanation text.
The rest of the placement API uses first positional arg of the exception
classes to pass in the extra details. Having this inconsistency makes
really hard to print proper error messages from the osc-placement
plugin.

This patch removes the incosistency by changing the code to use the
positional arg.

The change does not affect nova.scheduler.client.report._RE_INV_IN_USE
regex usage as that regex applied via re.search() and this change only
adds a new sentece to the message.

Change-Id: I196c2e3dabcbf0564c1ca0bd4870dc2df3efc836
Close-Bug: #1771325

[{'created': '2018-05-16 05:27:20.000000000', 'message': 'Improve Mistral API DB error handling

Everywhere the DB API is used, errors related to DB connectivity,
deadlocks or similar operational errors can happen. In order to
compensate this, all DB API calls are surrounded by the same retry
logic that matches the REST requirements (reasonable response time,
service specific error message)

Change-Id: I24227e1a763114b9895ac8901b7096445b7df77f
(cherry picked from commit f0b51965664a51881c294e3455290ca9abd4054c)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve Mistral API DB error handling

Everywhere the DB API is used, errors related to DB connectivity,
deadlocks or similar operational errors can happen. In order to
compensate this, all DB API calls are surrounded by the same retry
logic that matches the REST requirements (reasonable response time,
service specific error message)

Change-Id: I24227e1a763114b9895ac8901b7096445b7df77f
(cherry picked from commit f0b51965664a51881c294e3455290ca9abd4054c)

commit_message:
Add 2.55 schema & update flavor API in flavors_client

Compute microversion 2.55 adds 'description' in
flavor APIs response and new API to update the same.

This commit fill the schema gap for that and also
add new updte flavor API in flavors_client lib.

Change-Id: I91c049c3aa9dab5a272369edd18f2c5890d1e5b0

commit_message:
Improve Mistral API DB error handling

Everywhere the DB API is used, errors related to DB connectivity,
deadlocks or similar operational errors can happen. In order to
compensate this, all DB API calls are surrounded by the same retry
logic that matches the REST requirements (reasonable response time,
service specific error message)

Change-Id: I24227e1a763114b9895ac8901b7096445b7df77f

commit_message:
Update auth_url in install docs

1. Beginning with the Queens release, the keystone install guide
recommends running all interfaces on the same port. This patch
updates the install guide to reflect that change.
2. update the deprecated neutron auth options

Change-Id: I5c0a6389b759153bae06fa43846f03ac083c3db4

commit_message:
Remove kubetoolbox image from common role

Since the kolla-kubernetes has been separated, and nowhere to
use kubetoolbox, it is safe to remove it from kolla-ansible.

Change-Id: I9aa59d45fa04c13944120f1f99af2361551147ad

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 20:48:01.000000000', 'message': "Error if deployment fails

During some of the recent refactoring, we lost tripleoclient returning
non-zero when the 'tripleo deploy' command fails. This patch adds a
check to the return code to ensure we throw an error if it failed.

Change-Id: I82144af35f5f9cd57ef794cc58c33b0ab15b02b2
Related-Blueprint: all-in-one
"}]
commit_message:
Error if deployment fails

During some of the recent refactoring, we lost tripleoclient returning
non-zero when the 'tripleo deploy' command fails. This patch adds a
check to the return code to ensure we throw an error if it failed.

Change-Id: I82144af35f5f9cd57ef794cc58c33b0ab15b02b2
Related-Blueprint: all-in-one

messages:
[{'account_id': 23226, 'date': '2018-03-29 07:25:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20191, 'date': '2018-03-29 07:41:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

INFO-
Before removing these files we have to ensure that python-masakariclient uses latest python-openstacksdk which contains masakari commands. In other words python-masakariclient must have openstacksdk>=0.11.X in requirements.txt which contains these commands.'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-03-29 16:10:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Pefer not to have is_new_sdk as the master should always be latest. One minor comment is why not openstacksdk>=0.12.X instead ?'}, {'account_id': 23226, 'date': '2018-03-30 04:50:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you, I will remove is_new_sdk() in the next patch set.
And what we have to do next is below:
1. Wait for the openstacksdk0.12.1 release which contains https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555710/ .
2. Update the openstacksdk lower version to 0.12.1 on global-requirements.txt.
3. Update required openstacksdk version to 0.12.1 on this patch's requirements.txt."}, {'account_id': 23226, 'date': '2018-03-30 04:54:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

sorry, s/lower/lowest/'}, {'account_id': 23226, 'date': '2018-04-02 07:01:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-04-02 19:06:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

thanks and one least concern stated before that host, process and instance are all for instance_ha type now?'}, {'account_id': 8988, 'date': '2018-05-07 08:28:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Openstack-sdk which contains masakari code was released as 0.13.0.
And, that version was specified in upper-constraint.txt.[1]
But, lower-constraint is still 0.11.2.[2]

[1]https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/upper-constraints.txt#L392
[2]https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/lower-constraints.txt#L410'}, {'account_id': 20191, 'date': '2018-05-14 08:13:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-05-15 03:58:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20191, 'date': '2018-05-16 02:11:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-05-16 02:12:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12950, 'date': '2018-05-16 02:13:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM.'}]

This patch removes the proxy class from masakariclient, and modifies
to use the proxy class implemented on openstacksdk.

"}, {'created': '2018-05-16 02:11:17.000000000', 'message': "Remove masakariclient's proxy class

commands to openstacksdk and those are available in openstacksdk
version 0.13.0. So the respective sdk resource proxy class implemented
in masakariclient is no longer required.

This patch fixes below:

  proxy class implemented in openstacksdk.
- Related bug: #1756047

commit_message:
Remove masakariclient's proxy class

Change I9b2d140065390d94dda532c39777cf691775e21e has added masakari
commands to openstacksdk and those are available in openstacksdk
version 0.13.0. So the respective sdk resource proxy class implemented
in masakariclient is no longer required.

This patch fixes below:
- Removes the proxy class from masakariclient, and modifies to use the
  proxy class implemented in openstacksdk.
- Related bug: #1756047

Closes-Bug: #1756047
Change-Id: I5ecc4f8edc283e16cc7a1bd83a0a21735135199c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-01 15:43:42.000000000', 'message': 'add tripleo update job as voting

    add an update non-voting job to mimimal check

    Goal: in two diff commits.
    Use the update job to gate:
    - tripleo-quickstart
    - tripleo-quickstart-extras
    - tripleo-upgrade

    Use the update job to check non-voting
    - tripleo-$other repos

    At the moment tripleo-upgrade is ungated.
    To properly protect against changes in tripleo
    repos it is useful to run the update job as
    non-voting to help detect if a tripleo change
    caused the update job to fail.

Change-Id: I40e44df957e707cb3dd0af93df4d9d9d9205ffeb
'}, {'created': '2018-05-07 19:10:15.000000000', 'message': 'add tripleo update job as voting

    Use the update job to check non-voting
    - tripleo-$other repos

    At the moment tripleo-upgrade is ungated.

Change-Id: I40e44df957e707cb3dd0af93df4d9d9d9205ffeb

* this marks the job as gating/voting

commit_message:
Improve heat launcher user retrieval

Use getent argument to not list all users, and pwd/grp when on local
machine.

Change-Id: If98a88fa7e0b0b9cbd97fec662425650d67b49d0

commit_message:
deploy-steps: switch to tripleo_role_name

"role_name" is internal to Ansible, we should not use it.
This patch uses the new variable set in the inventory to use a specific
TripleO var: tripleo_role_name which is the TripleO role name and not
the Ansible role names, both things are very different.

Depends-On: I57c4eac87e2f96dfe5490b111cd2508505715d56
Change-Id: Iecaf6f1b830e65be2f9e2e44431054fe46f9f565
Related-Bug: #1771171

commit_message:
Include 'tripleo_role_name' in the inventory

"role_name" is internal to Ansible, we should not use it.
As a transition, include "tripleo_role_name" in the inventory and once
we're ready we'll remove our usage of "role_name", in a future patch.

Related-Bug: #1771171
Change-Id: I57c4eac87e2f96dfe5490b111cd2508505715d56
Depends-On: Id52a9c6b40c2af0e1fb40476a50669b2e07d3541

commit_message:
Use tripleo_role_name instead of role_name

role_name is private in Ansible 2.2 and we were lucky that it worked
until 2.4 but now in 2.5 it conflicts with tripleo vars.
We need to stop using it as we rename it here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bug/1771171

Change-Id: Id52a9c6b40c2af0e1fb40476a50669b2e07d3541
Related-Bug: #1771171

commit_message:
Adds Create Container Workflow

This patch adds a workflow to update the parameters in a given
deployment plan so the tripleo.plan.create_container action does
not need to be called directly.

Change-Id: I7144b927b02f162433acc9481a43950d2c77cd9b
Closes-Bug: #1759308

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 08:43:02.000000000', 'message': 'add tripleo update job as non-voting

    add an update non-voting job to mimimal check

    Goal: in two diff commits.
    Use the update job to gate:
    - tripleo-quickstart
    - tripleo-quickstart-extras
    - tripleo-upgrade

    Use the update job to check non-voting
    - tripleo-$other repos

    At the moment tripleo-upgrade is ungated.
    To properly protect against changes in tripleo
    repos it is useful to run the update job as

commit_message:
Install Octavia amphora image if Red Hat

For a one-click deployment, the Octavia amphora image must be present in
the undercloud node. Currently users need to ensure the image file
exists before overcloud deployment. For Red Hat-based deployments, the
image is provided by package octavia-amphora-image. Thus the package
should be installed for a better user experience leading to a truly
one-click deployment.

Closes-Bug: #1770117
Change-Id: I3ed8144b52ba528f449a4abe5c2106a5c61f9d61

commit_message:
Validate that there should not be XFS volumes with ftype=0

If  we have XFS partitions formatted with ftype=0,
the upgrades will fail because ftype=0 is incompatible
with the docker overlayfs driver.

Related-Bug: 1765121
Change-Id: I895fc83d148523c283664080b7b1bf75d53d9edb
(cherry picked from commit a5e63ee72531c85ee527ce721022fffce3cfcf75)
(cherry picked from commit d54ae2d1e21245f7033107e1bae327621f54f82f)

Upper requirements recently bumped sphinx from 1.6.5 to 1.7.4 which

Change-Id: I22bfaf4debdf96d902f2158e541cd5036ec1b1dd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for sphinx >1.7

Upper requirements recently bumped sphinx from 1.6.5 to 1.7.4 which
breaks our docs job. This switches the apidocs build to use
sphinxcontrib.apidoc.

messages: [{'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2018-05-15 19:42:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-05-15 19:43:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22477, 'date': '2018-05-15 23:45:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-15 19:42:37.000000000', 'message': 'Update prometheus service discovery for openstack-exporter

This updates the prometheus service discovery configuration
to define the openstack-exporter service discovery separate from
the other services. This allows for relabeling the instance label
for the openstack-exporter service, removing the potential for
multiple data series being returned by the single stat panels in
the Grafana dashboards for the openstack services. As the other
services perform as expected when exporter pods restart, they
remain configured the same as before.

Change-Id: Iad4c56d31fb553a9629f5a6fd1eac5464207add4
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <wilkers.steve@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update prometheus service discovery for openstack-exporter

This updates the prometheus service discovery configuration
to define the openstack-exporter service discovery separate from
the other services. This allows for relabeling the instance label
for the openstack-exporter service, removing the potential for
multiple data series being returned by the single stat panels in
the Grafana dashboards for the openstack services. As the other
services perform as expected when exporter pods restart, they
remain configured the same as before.

Change-Id: Iad4c56d31fb553a9629f5a6fd1eac5464207add4
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <wilkers.steve@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix HTTP500 error of changes-since on v2.0 API

The experimental job legacy-tempest-dsvm-nova-v20-api failed at the gate
always, because test_list_servers_by_changes_since_invalid_date touched
less validation part on the API.
This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I0284a83a92d39d211af6108ed6cae2d8fe19da8f
Close-Bug: #1770705

commit_message:
Make neutron-tempest-plugin-designate-scenario voting

As this job looks very stable since quite long time, we decided
on Neutron CI meeting to promote it to be voting in check queue.

Change-Id: Ibfd35f6a5ba37f62590a0208dc74c4cee7d23b0a

commit_message:
V3 jsonschema validation: volume_transfer

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below volume transfer API's
* POST /v3/{project_id}/os-volume-transfer
* POST  /v3/{project_id}/os-volume-transfer/{transfer_id}/accept

Modified existing unit test cases which were mistakenly passed
'transer_id' in request body which is supposed to pass in path.

Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

Change-Id: Idcbfd37d49584ed6cb438cfdc0e7403504977525

commit_message:
Log backup_service.restore() exception

If _detach_device() fails, the original exception raised by
backup_service.restore() will not be logged. Adding a log
statement in the exception handler.

Change-Id: Ibbc096981e2648aa06311d197b25c9be98caf3d3
Closes-bug: #1769740

commit_message:
python3: Add experimental jobs for functional and fullstack

As part of community goal to have services working with Python 3.5, this
patch adds back the exeperimental Python 3.5 functional and fullstack jobs
that got lost somewhere during zuul v3 migration.

Change-Id: I24506b94f3f4e111b3968e57deb683e9c874941c

commit_message:
Remove ironic_host_manager usage

The baremetal scheduling options were deprecated
in Pike and the ironic_host_manager was deprecated
in Queens and has now been removed. Deployments
must use resource classes now for baremetal scheduling.

Depends-On: I695b250c82c8dcedcd8e2bee00c56bb2df19212c
Change-Id: I20d45db6925f7534837e8d00d4d78f06b7c9897d

commit_message:
[Newton Only] Fix getting live value of nova/neutron during update.

In Ieb92ff161d1684c214382c5eb6b5949efc3fe75c we collect the current
value of neutron and nova host parameter.

It appears that we introduced a syntactic bug that was undetected
in the test environment.

This fixes those issues.

Change-Id: I06abb6e0a872319ef958b40ad32384928fa2bc9d
Resolve-Bug: #1771324

commit_message:
Call L3 checks before/after Role upgrade.

It worth calling L3-agent checks before and after each role
is upgrade.
This helps to narrow down when the packet loss or L3 failover
occurs.

Change-Id: I058d0171266c21f9ec398018095fd73d8597b745
(cherry picked from commit 5ca79c26ada5cc503df939b53c8dd5f7ffc4cbe8)

commit_message:
Prepare call, add --modify-role and --modify-vars

This allows the prepare command to set modify_role and modify_vars in
the call to container_images_prepare. The result will be an images
file that has extra options set in every entry.

The actual modification on the images is done during the upload
command, driven by these extra options.

Change-Id: Ia1dc7a1b7f777ac3e000f0c2e155be6330c05a2c
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow
Depends-On: I2c877a96264b351b4fc8527a3e40b87ddcb4f9a5

commit_message:
Update resource tree for elasticsearch/kibana

This adds the entry for resources for the apache proxy running in
the elasticsearch client and kibana pods. This also fixes an
incorrect enabled flag for resources in the kibana chart

Change-Id: Ifcd33a680167d7debfae2c4d71bdcb693632fce9

commit_message:
Persist package update ansible logs

We need to store the ansible playbook logs into persistent location.
We do it by ANSIBLE_LOG_PATH: /var/lib/mistral/package_update.log

Change-Id: I522acab84833b942865dc57156f3de99779d4f43
Resolves: rhbz#1572827

commit_message:
Implement image customization during upload

This allows an ansible role to be invoked after the image pull and
before the image push during an upload operation.

This mechanism can be used to modify images for tasks such:
- updating to latest packages during a CI run
- modifying an image to add a vendor plugin
- adding local developer code to an image to test deployment

Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

Change-Id: I2c877a96264b351b4fc8527a3e40b87ddcb4f9a5

commit_message:
Update nfs-provisioner and ldap deployment scripts

This updates the lma-nfs-provisioner deployment script to run make
on the nfs-provisioner chart. Previously, it relied on the local
image registry deployment step being run to lint and package the
nfs-provisioner chart. This change allows the nfs-provisioner to
be deployed without the local image registry if desired.

This also updates the ldap deployment script to only run make on
the ldap chart instead of pulling the default images with the
make-pull directive

Change-Id: I3d8f321d7a8af50fd80ffbd6a337fa17675f5700

I just don't think this should be done until we get the nested resource providers working for unnumbered request groups in allocation candidates.

Once that work is finished, I have a feeling that this will need to be looked at in a different light."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-16 18:33:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(10 comments)

> I just don't think this should be done until we get the nested resource providers working for unnumbered request groups in allocation candidates.
> 
> Once that work is finished, I have a feeling that this will need to be looked at in a different light.

I thought that through, and while I agree I would rather see the NRP work go first, I don't think it's going to make a difference in the overall approach.  Right now the algorithm breaks down as:

 for each request group:
     if use_same_provider:
         look for one provider matching the request group
     else:
         look for [root+sharing]s that collectively match the request group
 merge

With NRP, it will be

 for each request group:
     if use_same_provider:
         look for one provider matching the request group
     else:
         look for [tree+sharing]s that collectively match the request group
 merge

I was assuming the "tree+sharing" method would be a drop-in replacement for "root+sharing".  Just a question of which one of us drops it in :)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-16 18:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-16 19:33:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

This is nicely chunkified, thanks for that.

May be my lack of coffee, but I'm struggling to see how this is meanginful/useful without nested being present first? I agree that the overarching algorithm makes sense, but wonder if it is possible to test in a meanginful fashion as is. That is: what does a number request even mean without nested?

Anyway, I think it is moving in the right direction. I'd like us, at some point, to explore moving more of this into sql and moving more of the sql into testable chunks (the tests would validate that the sql is what we expect)."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-26 13:51:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25:

Sharing providers.  I plan to write some convincing test cases; hopefully that'll help.

 > Sure.  But you're okay with this merge-and-filter approach as a
 > first pass?

Oh yeah, definitely.

commit_message:
placement: Granular GET /allocation_candidates

In a new microversion, the GET /allocation_candidates API now accepts
granular resource request syntax:
?resourcesN=...&requiredN=...&member_ofN=...&group_policy={isolate|none}

Change-Id: I4e99974443aa513fd9f837a6057f67d744caf1b4
blueprint: granular-resource-requests

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567860/ without this change failed as expected, and now I've rebased it on top of this change so we'll see if it fixes it."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-12 01:40:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

LGTM, the tests are a bit confusing to follow, but they are legacy damage. The real thing I care about is the change on top of this which recreated the failure is now happy:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567860/

I'm wondering if there is a way we could work that into our gating system. We want to make sure we run live migration with the defaults (qcow2 and iso config drive) but I think we gate on a couple of jobs that run live migration (the multinode tempest job also runs live migration I think) so we could consider changing one of the jobs to also run with config drive to get additional coverage, and run with a different image type."}, {'account_id': 24441, 'date': '2018-05-14 00:56:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-05-14 03:01:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-05-14 06:32:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14510, 'date': '2018-05-14 09:16:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2018-05-14 09:33:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

FWIW, yes, using `qemu-img info` -- which is what Nova's get_disk_size() is calling, via qemu_img_info() -- is more correct."}, {'account_id': 27190, 'date': '2018-05-14 09:42:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27577, 'date': '2018-05-14 09:56:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2018-05-14 10:41:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-14 13:36:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Actually I realized that in my latest change to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567860/ that it's not running with config drive enabled, so let me make sure that's working first."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-14 15:01:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review -Workflow

The live migration job failed with force_config_drive=True, config_drive_format=vfat and images_type=raw:

http://logs.openstack.org/60/567860/6/check/nova-live-migration/702f809/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=TRACE#_May_14_14_39_42_271510'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-14 16:39:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
libvirt: Report the virtual size of RAW disks

If642e51a4e186833349a8e30b04224a3687f5594 started to correctly report
the actual size of preallocated file based disks but missed that this
value was later used as the virtual disk size for RAW disks.

This is an issue as nova.virt.libvirt.utils.create_image creates these
disks as sparse files with a reported actual size much smaller than the
virtual size. During block based LM this then results in disks
on the destination being created with a much smaller virtual size than
the disk should have leading to errors during the transfer.

Closes-Bug: #1770640
Change-Id: I464bc2b88123a012cd12213beac4b572c3c20a56

commit_message:
Fix wording and Typos in IRC page

While reviewing the IRC content page I found some
odd wording and typos.  Also I think we should say
what 'IRC' stands for.  This patch addresses
those things.

Change default endpoint map entries to use TLS

This changes the default entries to use TLS as a default for
the public endpoints.

commit_message:
[trivial] Correct erroneous Makefile comments

This patchset corrects some trivial copy/paste comment mistakes
in some Makefiles: Deckhand is referenced which is out of
place since the project is a third-party open source project that
clearly isn't the image being built. This corrects the reference
to the correct one per Makefile.

Change-Id: I372803ead251ff7909c1aef0f31b0188d1fdd1c9

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notify

This commit contains updates to introduced oslo.messaging
service in place of rabbitmq server.

This patch:
* Add ensure oslo.messaging vhost and user for backend
* Update service role installs
* Add oslo.messaging settings to test-vars

Change-Id: Ie69d522ee2df4282ce4fc69c2b3f81f4df1da77d

commit_message:
Horizon: Add support for performing message compilation

This PS adds support for message compilation, if the image supports
it.

Change-Id: Ie15a1a437ff516af697a5bb65c5c7831de872c30
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

messages:
[{'account_id': 28208, 'date': '2018-05-09 19:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-05-09 19:48:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 28208, 'date': '2018-05-09 20:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Question: command line is too long, should I split it with \ ?'}, {'account_id': 28208, 'date': '2018-05-14 12:20:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-05-15 18:39:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28208, 'date': '2018-05-15 21:01:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

My apologies. I was getting "find: 'xxxx': Permission denied" with 700 permissions set on directories, find was not able to propagate into var/lib/apt/lists/partial directory, but that was on older version, which you, Colleen, fixed. Thank you!'}, {'account_id': 28208, 'date': '2018-05-15 21:01:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
FIX: find: 'Permission denied' on certain images

Fixes 'find' failing when permissions are too restrictive.

Change-Id: I01676fb81b6fded1d7482d56601cf2544a25a3df
Signed-off-by: Roman Gorshunov <roman.gorshunov@att.com>

Remove mox in tests/unit/api/*/test_volumes.py

Replace mox with mock or stub_out in
nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_volumes.py.

Change-Id: I9acc2e4d6c57ea0f45ba161116993d9f1a0e1e9f
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 00:49:57.000000000', 'message': 'Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation

Curly quotes(Chinese punctuation) usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Change-Id: I39a4581cac33d6b2e2c62c938ba04b5d9e907bcb
'}]
commit_message:
Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation

Curly quotes(Chinese punctuation) usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Change-Id: I39a4581cac33d6b2e2c62c938ba04b5d9e907bcb

[{'created': '2018-03-14 20:36:23.000000000', 'message': "Test creating multiple volumes from image simultaneously

This test aims to help find issues in volume drivers and
Cinder's image download internals.

It creates five volumes simultaneously from the same image.

Change-Id: I72d73c3e0e6160126a95103e36ab073a78ff8b3f
"}, {'created': '2018-03-14 20:41:39.000000000', 'message': "Test creating multiple volumes from image simultaneously

commit_message:
Test creating multiple volumes from image simultaneously

This test aims to help find issues in volume drivers and
Cinder's image download internals.

It creates five volumes simultaneously from the same image.

Depends-On: I2ae36c4e90bd7b3340861ceec23dee406ea48214
Change-Id: I72d73c3e0e6160126a95103e36ab073a78ff8b3f

commit_message:
Use assertTrue and assertFalse vs assertEqual

Using assertTrue and assertFalse is more readable while
checking a boolean result.

Note: In the following files we have to use assertEqual,
      since the api returns the value as unicode:
tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_get.py
65:            self.assertEqual('true', fetched_volume['bootable'])
65:            self.assertEqual('true', fetched_volume['bootable'])
114:            self.assertEqual('true', updated_volume['bootable'])
114:            self.assertEqual('true', updated_volume['bootable'])
tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_list.py
188:            self.assertEqual('false', volume['bootable'])
tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_get.py
67:            self.assertEqual('false', fetched_volume['bootable'])
116:            self.assertEqual('false', updated_volume['bootable'])
tempest/api/compute/servers/test_servers_negative.py
533:        self.assertEqual('false', nonbootable_vol['bootable'])

Change-Id: I004a7860847e8361280d3fa105d2dfa97d99bee4

[{'created': '2018-05-14 20:14:20.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Report the virtual size of RAW disks

If642e51a4e186833349a8e30b04224a3687f5594 started to correctly report
the actual size of preallocated file based disks but missed that this
value was later used as the virtual disk size for RAW disks.

This is an issue as nova.virt.libvirt.utils.create_image creates these
disks as sparse files with a reported actual size much smaller than the
virtual size. During block based LM this then results in disks
on the destination being created with a much smaller virtual size than
the disk should have leading to errors during the transfer.

Closes-Bug: #1770640
Change-Id: I464bc2b88123a012cd12213beac4b572c3c20a56
(cherry picked from commit 016986f4706e881fed16c85c8790af4d26a7c351)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Report the virtual size of RAW disks

If642e51a4e186833349a8e30b04224a3687f5594 started to correctly report
the actual size of preallocated file based disks but missed that this
value was later used as the virtual disk size for RAW disks.

This is an issue as nova.virt.libvirt.utils.create_image creates these
disks as sparse files with a reported actual size much smaller than the
virtual size. During block based LM this then results in disks
on the destination being created with a much smaller virtual size than
the disk should have leading to errors during the transfer.

Closes-Bug: #1770640
Change-Id: I464bc2b88123a012cd12213beac4b572c3c20a56
(cherry picked from commit 016986f4706e881fed16c85c8790af4d26a7c351)

[{'created': '2018-05-05 01:11:29.000000000', 'message': 'Added ability to configure default architecture for ImagePropertiesFilter

When using ImagePropertiesFilter with multiple architectures inside the
same deployment, it is possible that images can be uploaded without the
hw_architecture property defined.

This results in behaviour where the instance could be scheduled on any
type of hypervisor, resulting in an instance that will successfully
transition to ACTIVE but never properly run because of the difference
in architecture.

This makes the ImagePropertiesFilter problematic as most images are
generally uploaded without the architecture property set because
most documentation does not encourage doing that.

The addition of this flag allows to make using the filter possible
because it allows the deployer to assume a default architecture if
the user did not supply one (assuming it would be the most common
architecture in their deployment, such as x86_64) yet if the user
wants a more specific architecture, they can do it in their image
properties.

Change-Id: Ib52deb095028e93619b93ef9e5f70775df2a403a
Closes-Bug: #1769283

commit_message:
Added ability to configure default architecture for ImagePropertiesFilter

When using ImagePropertiesFilter with multiple architectures inside the
same deployment, it is possible that images can be uploaded without the
hw_architecture property defined.

This results in behaviour where the instance could be scheduled on any
type of hypervisor, resulting in an instance that will successfully
transition to ACTIVE but never properly run because of the difference
in architecture.

This makes the ImagePropertiesFilter problematic as most images are
generally uploaded without the architecture property set because
most documentation does not encourage doing that.

The addition of this flag allows to make using the filter possible
because it allows the deployer to assume a default architecture if
the user did not supply one (assuming it would be the most common
architecture in their deployment, such as x86_64) yet if the user
wants a more specific architecture, they can do it in their image
properties.

In order to avoid a circular import loop, the references to the
architecture field have been moved to a seperate module so that
they can be properly and cleaned imported inside configuration.

Change-Id: Ib52deb095028e93619b93ef9e5f70775df2a403a
Closes-Bug: #1769283

commit_message:
Correct contianer network creation and test it

The container network creation process needs to assume that the bridge
name is available and fall back to the interface. Previously this was
being done in reverse.

Change-Id: I51829349b5bc3f97c100a379b13f7e99f4007228
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
devstack: support non-legacy neutron

This adjust the devstack plugin code to work in the case
where new neutron devstack service names (neutron-*) are
used instead of the neutron-legacy devstack services names (q-*).

Change-Id: I557cf268ae12cce3352330ec0d30006f3d598f2e
Depends-On: I55aefa9ac1aaf0f69a7a31365439141633183722
Closes-Bug: 1769601

commit_message:
Patch Pike to fix apache process detection when mod_perl is installed

Patch in a fix for apache process detection when mod_perl is installed,
without this fix the apache process will sometimes not be found
correctly due to name mismatch.
Upstream request at: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565359

Change-Id: I9aefa7c2867aab4095d83a65a28e5652acfdcbd3

'complain' testing with filestore and bluestore based OSD's
with journals, db and wal devices.

Tested with Ceph Luminous on 18.04 including data generation

commit_message:
Misc updates to apparmor profile

Minor refactoring and updates for DENIED messages seen during
'complain' testing with filestore and bluestore based OSD's
with journals, db and wal devices.

Tested with Ceph Luminous on 18.04 including data generation
using rados bench and pg resizing from 8 -> 256 during testing.

Change-Id: I705eacfe4d464b96dde25495eecb95db30423b66

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: If7049561c6a9e94fc5074112db9597cd8cb6996e
Depends-On: I4c82a63baabd6b9304b302c97cd751a0103d8316
Depends-On: I0dd36ef1f1f5dcdc57413736ecb8f2555712c36d
Closes-Bug: #1759098

subject: WIP "Admin manage all" feature
messages:
[{'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-04-19 05:06:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-04-23 15:25:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

The scope of this patch will be to let admin be able to manage all (where appropriate), except plugins.

Still todo: (besides the inline comments)
* Figure out what happens when admin tries to delete a cluster of a deleted project, and account for that behavior  
* Think about how to expose 'manage all feature' explicitly, because we don't want admin to suddenly start doing things they couldn't do. It needs to come from some API feature  
* Look at how, for example, Nova or Neutron does it: when does admin explicitly have to say "I am trying to administer resources in another project", and when is it totally implicit/automatic'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-05-15 17:20:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-07 17:03:56.000000000', 'message': "Fixing bug where original and new dicts would always be the same

* Calling Resource.to_dict() does not make a deep copy of the
dict.  Because of this, modifications to values in the 'new' dict would
also modify the original dict, thus defeating the purpose of the
jsonpatch comparison.

Change-Id: I1b72775b729e040d1b44658d50dcd93768f07a6e
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing bug where original and new dicts would always be the same

* Calling Resource.to_dict() does not make a deep copy of the
dict.  Because of this, modifications to values in the 'new' dict would
also modify the original dict, thus defeating the purpose of the
jsonpatch comparison.

Change-Id: I1b72775b729e040d1b44658d50dcd93768f07a6e

commit_message:
Backup and restore scenario

This testcase verifies content preservation after backup and restore
operations by booting a server from a restored backup and check the
connectivity to it, this will indicate that the image data was preserved.

Added:
- 'create_backup' method in scenario/manager
- 'restore_backup' method in scenario/manager

Change-Id: I20ebf2bb2e4950c24d912c24a081dc0ac0101b8d

commit_message:
copy iPXE NBP to /tftpboot during PXE bootstrap

This allows you to chainload iPXE from a standard PXE
environment.

As the PXE container already has apache installed, we
now have everything we need to support iPXE booting.

Change-Id: Ide32dc1910e9f8b3ff875238648726f719e271b2
Implements: blueprint ironic-ipxe

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-11 18:47:36.000000000', 'message': 'Don't reschedule on RequestedVRamTooHigh errors

The libvirt driver validates the hw_video_ram image property,
if specified, and the flavor extra spec "hw_video:ram_max_mb"
is set. If validation fails, the libvirt driver raises
RequestedVRamTooHigh which is not handled explicitly in
ComputeManager._build_and_run_instance so it will result in
a RescheduledException to another compute to retry the spawn
but that will always fail because this isn't something that
is per-compute host.

This change adds the error handling in _build_and_run_instance
so that we'll fail and abort the build and not reschedule.

Long-term, this validation should be moved into the API code
since it's not specific to a compute host and would be user
error that should result in a 400 response.

Change-Id: I93b409ca2b7b36400759ee9d2cd5b71c6df186ab
Partial-Bug: #1770726
'}]
commit_message:
Don't reschedule on RequestedVRamTooHigh errors

The libvirt driver validates the hw_video_ram image property,
if specified, and the flavor extra spec "hw_video:ram_max_mb"
is set. If validation fails, the libvirt driver raises
RequestedVRamTooHigh which is not handled explicitly in
ComputeManager._build_and_run_instance so it will result in
a RescheduledException to another compute to retry the spawn
but that will always fail because this isn't something that
is per-compute host.

This change adds the error handling in _build_and_run_instance
so that we'll fail and abort the build and not reschedule.

Long-term, this validation should be moved into the API code
since it's not specific to a compute host and would be user
error that should result in a 400 response.

Change-Id: I93b409ca2b7b36400759ee9d2cd5b71c6df186ab
Partial-Bug: #1770726

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-08 11:47:29.000000000', 'message': "Avoid agents adding ports as trunk by default.

Agent OVS interface code adds ports without a vlan tag,
if neutron-openvswitch-agent fails to set the tag, or takes
too long, the port will be a trunk port, receiving
traffic from the external network or any other port
sending traffic on br-int.

Also, those kinds of ports are triggering a code path
on the ovs-vswitchd revalidator thread which can eventually
hog the CPU of the host (that's a bug under investigation [1])

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1558336

Change-Id: I024bbbdf7059835b2f23c264b48478c71633a43c
Closes-Bug: 1767422

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1558336

commit_message:
Avoid agents adding ports as trunk by default.

Agent OVS interface code adds ports without a vlan tag,
if neutron-openvswitch-agent fails to set the tag, or takes
too long, the port will be a trunk port, receiving
traffic from the external network or any other port
sending traffic on br-int.

Also, those kinds of ports are triggering a code path
on the ovs-vswitchd revalidator thread which can eventually
hog the CPU of the host (that's a bug under investigation [1])

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1558336

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_ovs_lib.py

    needed the addition of the following import:
from neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.openvswitch.agent.common import (
    constants as agent_const)

Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I024bbbdf7059835b2f23c264b48478c71633a43c
Closes-Bug: 1767422
(cherry picked from commit 88f5e11d8bf820b0124be0f6ec3c2d96011592d9)
(cherry picked from commit 2b1d413ee90dfe2e9ae41c35ab37253df53fc6cd)

commit_message:
Add mount options for better machinectl performance

The machinectl default options, while functional, could be tuned for
better overall performance. This change adds several options which will
ensure container workloads are using the lest amount of storage with the
best possible performance.

For more information on the options being used see
 * https://btrfs.wiki.kernel.org/index.php/Manpage/btrfs(5)#MOUNT_OPTIONS

Change-Id: Idb47c008819a3f9e917fe1cac46e228d83683d21
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add openstack_openrc role to common test requirements

With https://review.openstack.org/568139 merging this is now
a common requirement, so ensure that all roles have it.

The roles are also re-arranged alphanumerically by name.

Change-Id: I7b21971eeb0dbf9f4190b5a76afaa04c1bf9db45

[{'created': '2018-04-18 21:01:05.000000000', 'message': 'Make OVSDB debug logging optional

OVSDB debug messages are very chatty and make log files much bigger
without a lot of benefit 99.9% of the time. If there is ever a need
for them because we are having a *really* weird OVSDB issue, then
we can configure the jobs to turn them back on.

Change-Id: I1d1e5e312509022084bcb651968bb9543ff61ba4
Closes-Bug: #1687065
'}]
commit_message:
Make OVSDB debug logging optional

OVSDB debug messages are very chatty and make log files much bigger
without a lot of benefit 99.9% of the time. If there is ever a need
for them because we are having a *really* weird OVSDB issue, then
we can configure the jobs to turn them back on.

Change-Id: I1d1e5e312509022084bcb651968bb9543ff61ba4
Closes-Bug: #1687065

Pypi url changed from [1] to [2]

[1] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/<package>
[2] https://pypi.org/project/<package>

commit_message:
Trivial: Update pypi url to new url

Pypi url changed from [1] to [2]

[1] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/<package>
[2] https://pypi.org/project/<package>

Change-Id: Ib73611ba0da839d46c845967aacf889ccbde9a19

commit_message:
ovs,neutron: use auto_bridge_add for external bridge and interface

Also changed ovs-agent-init to take care of configuring default external
bridge and interface for cosistency with lb-agent.

Change-Id: I1d893b73a784f55594c30f17ef022348d68f0f1b

commit_message:
Add documentation job for openstack-helm-infra

As openstack-helm is an official project, this adds a docs
publishing job for openstack-helm-infra. This allows us to include
docs for the services hosted in the openstack-helm-infra repo to
match the docs layout for the charts in openstack-helm

Change-Id: Ifc94f63f5d3e701f33b08ea5ebf4e5a20a143615

commit_message:
remove cap on networkx

This is the first step in updating networkx.

After this, requirements will have a DNM patch to update the constraint on
networkx for projects to test against.  Once the following projects work with
the new networkx the upper-constraints patch will merge.

diskimage-builder
fuel  # not following constraints
mistral
octavia
rpm-packaging
solar  # no cap on networkx already
taskflow
vitrage
watcher

Partial-Bug: #1718576
Change-Id: I34045f87ca19c2f184b040f4d89347374cce518b

commit_message:
Correctly detects apache process when mod_perl is installed

Apache mod_perl sets the process name to the full command path
which is truncated to 15 characters by Linux convention. Adds
/usr/sbin/httpd to the apache process known names to the apache
detection plugin.

Change-Id: I6d45e9e6d5aef46d3a230911e7778d6ab7ca9265
story: 2001945
task: 15063

commit_message:
Correctly detects apache process when mod_perl is installed

Apache mod_perl sets the process name to the full command path
which is truncated to 15 characters by Linux convention. Adds
/usr/sbin/httpd to the apache process known names to the apache
detection plugin.

Change-Id: I6d45e9e6d5aef46d3a230911e7778d6ab7ca9265
story: 2001945
task: 15063

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-15 12:28:43.000000000', 'message': 'Added ability to configure default architecture for ImagePropertiesFilter

When using ImagePropertiesFilter with multiple architectures inside the
same deployment, it is possible that images can be uploaded without the
hw_architecture property defined.

This results in behaviour where the instance could be scheduled on any
type of hypervisor, resulting in an instance that will successfully
transition to ACTIVE but never properly run because of the difference
in architecture.

This makes the ImagePropertiesFilter problematic as most images are
generally uploaded without the architecture property set because
most documentation does not encourage doing that.

The addition of this flag allows to make using the filter possible
because it allows the deployer to assume a default architecture if
the user did not supply one (assuming it would be the most common
architecture in their deployment, such as x86_64) yet if the user
wants a more specific architecture, they can do it in their image
properties.

In order to avoid a circular import loop, the references to the
architecture field have been moved to a seperate module so that
they can be properly and cleaned imported inside configuration.

Change-Id: Ib52deb095028e93619b93ef9e5f70775df2a403a
Closes-Bug: #1769283
(cherry picked from commit aa5b1326c86c408ce9cc4546e1c7a310fbce3136)
'}]
commit_message:
Added ability to configure default architecture for ImagePropertiesFilter

When using ImagePropertiesFilter with multiple architectures inside the
same deployment, it is possible that images can be uploaded without the
hw_architecture property defined.

This results in behaviour where the instance could be scheduled on any
type of hypervisor, resulting in an instance that will successfully
transition to ACTIVE but never properly run because of the difference
in architecture.

This makes the ImagePropertiesFilter problematic as most images are
generally uploaded without the architecture property set because
most documentation does not encourage doing that.

The addition of this flag allows to make using the filter possible
because it allows the deployer to assume a default architecture if
the user did not supply one (assuming it would be the most common
architecture in their deployment, such as x86_64) yet if the user
wants a more specific architecture, they can do it in their image
properties.

In order to avoid a circular import loop, the references to the
architecture field have been moved to a seperate module so that
they can be properly and cleaned imported inside configuration.

Change-Id: Ib52deb095028e93619b93ef9e5f70775df2a403a
Closes-Bug: #1769283
(cherry picked from commit aa5b1326c86c408ce9cc4546e1c7a310fbce3136)

commit_message:
Ensure the CephX Manila keyring permissions are only set when needed

Do not try to set the ACLs on the Manila CephX keyring if the
CephFS backend is not enabled; in that case the keyring does not
exist.

Change-Id: I2f0018c66bd071f9e2e0dfafb0339a5b891ed71a
Closes-Bug: 1770444

commit_message:
Fix syntax for setting enabled_import_methods

Glance's enabled_import_methods is a ListOpt, and requires explicit
brackets around the list of values. It throws an error if the brackets
are missing.

Related-Bug: #1765439
Change-Id: I6d1b839bdd391a515bc630b32da2fbfcf007f01f
(cherry picked from commit 71447a4993eb63ed5a9071e73c93a9291afa4f89)

commit_message:
Fix bug caused by tosca-parser changes policies monitoring sections
and keynames

The TOSCA parser change some of the keynames and sections of monitoring
policies which causes these testcases fail:

tacker.tests.unit.test_tosca_templates_under_samples.TestSamples:
+ test_list_samples
+ test_alarm_sample
tacker.tests.unit.vnfm.infra_drivers.openstack.test_openstack.TestOpenStack
+ test_create_tosca_alarm_respawn
+ test_create_tosca_with_alarm_monitoring_not_matched
+ test_create_tosca_alarm_scale

The keynames and sections are:

+ meter_name -> metric
+ period -> granularity
+ method -> aggregation_method

Change-Id: I9b790dde3cc1f447109f903ad2af630c5f2ead90
Closes-Bug: #1771106
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568631/

commit_message:
Add ldap support to nagios

This adds an apache reverse proxy to the nagios chart, similar
to elasticsearch and kibana. It also adds authentication to
nagios via ldap

subject: Reset resource replaced_by field for rollback
messages: [{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-05-15 10:45:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-05-15 13:27:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-05-15 13:31:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-15 10:45:01.000000000', 'message': 'Reset resource replaced_by field for rollback

We seem to leave replaced_by field of a resource after rollback
(if a stack cancel is issued before the replacement
resource is added to the stack). This in turn results in the
stack getting stuck in IN_PROGRESS for further updates.

Change-Id: I3361ad90e303d24a16a943408fe0f6c406cf785f
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Task: #19582
Story: #2001974
(cherry picked from commit a544ce43dc8e1bcdaf7657d7f35e03464f85241e)
'}]
commit_message:
Reset resource replaced_by field for rollback

We seem to leave replaced_by field of a resource after rollback
(if a stack cancel is issued before the replacement
resource is added to the stack). This in turn results in the
stack getting stuck in IN_PROGRESS for further updates.

Change-Id: I3361ad90e303d24a16a943408fe0f6c406cf785f
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Task: #19582
Story: #2001974
(cherry picked from commit a544ce43dc8e1bcdaf7657d7f35e03464f85241e)

subject: Move database creation into role
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-15 07:30:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-15 07:35:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-15 07:45:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-15 09:04:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:\n\nrecheck apt cache failure'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-05-15 13:58:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-05-15 15:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-15 07:30:25.000000000', 'message': "Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'glance_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
task to any host, but defaults to the first member of the galera_all
host group. We also document the variable glance_galera_address which
has been used for a long time, but never documented.

Change-Id: I1a875cfdece088838027fc7b4dafd812d8c2693b
"}, {'created': '2018-05-15 07:35:22.000000000', 'message': "Move database creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement a new variable called 'glance_db_setup_host'
which is used in the role to allow delegation of the database setup
