commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

We install packages twice, the -U for pip install will update requirements
to newer versions and might download even an older versions. Remove it.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/554297
Change-Id: Id6044cd7c4d17496bb31380cd045ee73d7ecae0c

subject: Rewrite of the client
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-30 16:33:37.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Rewrite of the client

The client has been completely rewritten in order to use cliff. The code should
be easier to maintain: authentication is now entirely handled by keystoneauth,
CloudKitty's client and CK's OSC plugin use the exact same classes (no code
duplication).

New features for users:

  * Client-side CSV report generation: It is possible for users to generate
    CSV reports with the new client. There is a default format, but reports
    may also be configured through a yaml config file. (see documentation)

  * The documentation has been improved. (A few examples on how to use the
    python library + complete API bindings and CLI reference).

  * It is now possible to use the client without Keystone authentication (this
    requires that CK's API is configured to use the noauth auth strategy).

  * Various features are brought by cliff: completion, command output formatting
    (table, shell, yaml, json...).

  * Simplification of commands. Most commands are now more http-like: no more
    'list' and 'get' commands, but only 'get' with or without a resource ID.

New features for developpers:
  * Python 2.7/3.5 compatible 'python-cloudkittyclient' module.

  * Integration tests (for 'openstack rating' and 'cloudkitty') have been
    added. These should allow to create gate jobs running against a CK devstack

  * Tests are now ran with stestr instead of testr, which allows a better
    control over execution.

  * The dependency list has been reduced and upper constraints have been set.

Change-Id: I47372160c044034d84ae46c93c5868f2ebe40041
Task: 6589
Story: 2001614

"}, {'created': '2018-04-04 14:50:11.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Rewrite of the client

[Currently creating devstack functional jobs]

The client has been completely rewritten in order to use cliff. The code should
be easier to maintain: authentication is now entirely handled by keystoneauth,
CloudKitty's client and CK's OSC plugin use the exact same classes (no code
duplication).

New features for users:

  * Client-side CSV report generation: It is possible for users to generate
    CSV reports with the new client. There is a default format, but reports
    may also be configured through a yaml config file. (see documentation)

  * The documentation has been improved. (A few examples on how to use the
    python library + complete API bindings and CLI reference).

  * It is now possible to use the client without Keystone authentication (this
    requires that CK's API is configured to use the noauth auth strategy).

  * Various features are brought by cliff: completion, command output formatting
    (table, shell, yaml, json...).

  * Simplification of commands. Most commands are now more http-like: no more
    'list' and 'get' commands, but only 'get' with or without a resource ID.

New features for developpers:
  * Python 2.7/3.5 compatible 'python-cloudkittyclient' module.

  * Integration tests (for 'openstack rating' and 'cloudkitty') have been
    added. These should allow to create gate jobs running against a CK devstack

  * Tests are now ran with stestr instead of testr, which allows a better
    control over execution.

  * The dependency list has been reduced and upper constraints have been set.

commit_message:
Rewrite of the client

The client has been completely rewritten in order to use cliff. The code
should be easier to maintain: authentication is now entirely handled by
keystoneauth, CloudKitty's client and CK's OSC plugin use the exact same
classes (no code duplication).

New features for users:

  * Client-side CSV report generation: It is possible for users to generate
    CSV reports with the new client. There is a default format, but reports
    may also be configured through a yaml config file. (see documentation)

  * The documentation has been improved. (A few examples on how to use the
    python library + complete API bindings and CLI reference).

  * It is now possible to use the client without Keystone authentication (this
    requires that CK's API is configured to use the noauth auth strategy).

  * Various features are brought by cliff: completion, command output formatting
    (table, shell, yaml, json...).

New features for developpers:
  * Python 2.7/3.5 compatible 'python-cloudkittyclient' module.

  * Integration tests (for 'openstack rating' and 'cloudkitty') have been
    added. These allow to create gate jobs running against a CK devstack

  * Tests are now ran with stestr instead of testr, which allows a better
    control over execution.

  * The dependency list has been reduced and upper constraints have been set.

Change-Id: I47372160c044034d84ae46c93c5868f2ebe40041
Task: 6589
Story: 2001614

commit_message:
Require the (soon-to-be) Rocky version of Horizon

... or at least the first published tarball which will lead to Rocky.
On the other side this means forcing the usage of mox as long as
there are tests that depends on it (the switch was already flipped
in Horizon, so it needs to be enabled here).

This allows us to depend on newer Horizon features, including changes
to the test suite that are useful for the mox removal effort.

Also fixes lower-constants.txt

Change-Id: I3908c6d212b9d1df7e4490128b6a0a3f751e8276
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Puppet incorrectly sets rgw_keystone_revocation_interval to absent

Puppet incorrectly sets rgw_keystone_revocation_interval when use_pki
is false. According to (1), the default value will be 15*60. This value
should be 0 when not using PKI tokens. This patch ensures the parameter
is set to the value passed into the module.

1: http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/radosgw/config-ref/

Change-Id: Ic8abf0c9d54847dad72824db211a5850737a05b8
Closes-bug: 1770234

commit_message:
Stop double json decoding API error messages

This patch adds support for the fixed error messages that aren't double
JSON encoded.

Change-Id: Ib39f65c89e3e96efddd9fa3b648145ae3d6159d3
Story: #1662228
Task: #19644

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-02 20:50:52.000000000', 'message': 'Make get_instance_objects_sorted() be smart about cells

This makes the get_instance_objects_sorted() method only query for instances
in cells that the tenant actually has instances landed in. We do this by getting
a list of cell mappings that have instance mappings owned by our project and
limiting the scatter/gather operation to just those cells. Per the behavior
in db/sqlalchemy/api, we always list all cells for admins.

Change-Id: I442621e2b4acd63d2cfc8a66ab5b32b64ebcaea0
'}, {'created': '2017-10-05 14:48:50.000000000', 'message': 'Make get_instance_objects_sorted() be smart about cells

This makes the get_instance_objects_sorted() method only query for instances
in cells that the tenant actually has instances landed in. We do this by getting
a list of cell mappings that have instance mappings owned by our project and
limiting the scatter/gather operation to just those cells. Per the behavior
in db/sqlalchemy/api, we always list all cells for admins.

Change-Id: I442621e2b4acd63d2cfc8a66ab5b32b64ebcaea0

commit_message:
Make get_instance_objects_sorted() be smart about cells

This makes the get_instance_objects_sorted() method only query for instances
in cells that the tenant actually has instances landed in. We do this by getting
a list of cell mappings that have instance mappings owned by our project and
limiting the scatter/gather operation to just those cells. Per the behavior
in db/sqlalchemy/api, we always list all cells for admins.

Change-Id: I442621e2b4acd63d2cfc8a66ab5b32b64ebcaea0

commit_message:
vars: Do not install build dependencies for distro installs

The glance_distro_packages contain packages which are build dependencies
to the 'PIP' ones so we don't need to install them when we are using the
Glance distribution packages. This also renames the '*glance_wsgi_bin'
to '*glance_uwsgi_bin' since it refers to the actual uwsgi package.
Finally, we add the missing 'install_method' conditional when recording
the local facts.

Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
Change-Id: I063a73ca7d50a0ad0bee57ccc42604802ab08220

'}, {'account_id': 23871, 'date': '2018-01-19 09:54:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-01-31 14:15:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

This seems really hacky to me. Like the distributed equivalent of adding a sleep() to a process to make it work better. We're waiting for events, but we don't do anything differently if they don't come in. What is the point? Other that slowing down the migration until the timeout, this has no real effect and I feel like maybe it only "helps" because of that slowing. More explanation of the theory is needed at the least.

This also doesn't have any unit or functional test coverage for the event code that is added to even ensure that it's being run as expected. We've identified that getting CI results to prove this is working is going to be difficult, yet it's extremely light on the "easy" test coverage.

Further, I share Matt's concern over being able to test this. The only saving grace is that this patch doesn't actually do anything differently (other than be slower), so the likelihood that this functionally breaks something is low. However, I don't really agree with the approach taken here, which means it's not a good enough reason to proceed without testing. I too would like to see this working, even if it's a throw-away experiment to poke it at one point in time.

Sahid, what have you tried in the way of getting a live-migration-capable linuxbridge job to run against this?'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-01-31 16:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

(3 comments)

Thanks for the review Dan.

I'm a bit worried to see you considering this fix hacky. Did you had a
chance to look at the commit message, there is an explanation of the
linux bridge agent mech?

So nothing hacky here, there are events sent by Neutron and we are trying
to fix the workflow by waiting for them.

About you saying that we do nothing if the events don't come... Did
you noticed that the condition is only if there is a timeout? - If
something *wrong* happens we have mechanism like a safeguard, "a
timeout", we ensure that the process does not wait undefinetly for the
events. It's not an expected case and we log a warning message in such
situation.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-01-31 18:33:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

> I'm a bit worried to see you considering this fix hacky. Did you
 > had a chance to look at the commit message, there is an explanation of
 > the linux bridge agent mech?

Yes I saw the commit message, which is why I commented on it specifically asking for more explanation of the logic.

 > So nothing hacky here, there are events sent by Neutron and we are
 > trying to fix the workflow by waiting for them.

Nothing hacky? Seems entirely hacky to me ;)

AFAICT, this is a sleep(300), where the sleep is short-circuited if we hear back from neutron.

 > About you saying that we do nothing if the events don't come... Did
 > you noticed that the condition is only if there is a timeout? 

Yes I saw it, that's why I commented specifically on the part where you log the timeout and then do the exact same thing.

 > - If something *wrong* happens we have mechanism like a safeguard, "a
 > timeout", we ensure that the process does not wait undefinetly for
 > the events. It's not an expected case and we log a warning message in
 > such situation.

If we didn't get the event, why not cancel the migration?'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-01-31 18:49:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-02-01 13:44:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

(3 comments)

[{'created': '2017-08-24 15:01:18.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: slowly live-migration to ensure network is ready

Closes-Bug: #1414559

Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I407034374fe17c4795762aa32575ba72d3a46fe8
'}, {'created': '2017-08-25 14:02:24.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: slowly live-migration to ensure network is ready

In Neutron, the commit b7c303ee0a16a05c1fdb476dc7f4c7ca623a3f58
introduced events sent during a live migration where the VIFs are well
plugged on destination node.

This commit takes care of making the live migration waiting for events
before to finish. It's important to note that, because Linux Bridge
agent mech is detecting new networks on destination only when the TAP
devices are created we can't make this process before to have called
libvirt to start migration (since libvirt is responsible of creating
the TAP devices)

Closes-Bug: #1414559
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I407034374fe17c4795762aa32575ba72d3a46fe8

"}, {'created': '2017-10-02 10:15:52.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: slow live-migration to ensure network is ready

In Neutron, commit b7c303ee0a16a05c1fdb476dc7f4c7ca623a3f58 introduced
events sent during a live migration when the VIFs are plugged on
destination node.

The Linux bridge agent mechanism driver is detecting new networks on
the destination host only when the TAP devices are created, and these
tap devices are only created when libvirt starts the migration. As a
result, we must actually start the migration and then slow it as we
wait for the neutron events.

This change ensures we wait for these events.

Depends-On: Icb039ae2d465e3822ab07ae4f9bc405c1362afba

Closes-Bug: #1414559
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I407034374fe17c4795762aa32575ba72d3a46fe8
'}, {'created': '2017-10-23 09:29:51.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: slow live-migration to ensure network is ready

destination node.

The Linux bridge agent mechanism driver is detecting new networks on
the destination host only when the TAP devices are created, and these
tap devices are only created when libvirt starts the migration. As a
result, we must actually start the migration and then slow it as we
wait for the neutron events.

This change ensures we wait for these events.

Depends-On: Icb039ae2d465e3822ab07ae4f9bc405c1362afba

The Linux bridge agent mechanism driver is detecting new networks on
the destination host only when the TAP devices are created, and these
tap devices are only created when libvirt starts the migration. As a
result, we must actually start the migration and then slow it as we
wait for the neutron events.

This change ensures we wait for these events.

Depends-On: Icb039ae2d465e3822ab07ae4f9bc405c1362afba

Closes-Bug: #1414559
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I407034374fe17c4795762aa32575ba72d3a46fe8

commit_message:
libvirt: slow live-migration to ensure network is ready

In Neutron, commit b7c303ee0a16a05c1fdb476dc7f4c7ca623a3f58 introduced
events sent during a live migration when the VIFs are plugged on
destination node.

The Linux bridge agent mechanism driver is detecting new networks on
the destination host only when the TAP devices are created, and these
tap devices are only created when libvirt starts the migration. As a
result, we must actually start the migration and then slow it as we
wait for the neutron events.

This change ensures we wait for these events.

Depends-On: Icb039ae2d465e3822ab07ae4f9bc405c1362afba

Closes-Bug: #1414559
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I407034374fe17c4795762aa32575ba72d3a46fe8

commit_message:
Reproduce navigations

Details view does not reproduce side menu and breadcrumb properly
by refreshing or linking directory.
This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Icc7cb8395a939cbac516289be285a81b8b0e58cb
Closes-Bug: #1746706

commit_message:
apparmor: Misc fixes for lbaasv2 profile

Ensure that profiles are correctly applied in network
namespace using profile flag.

Allow lbaasv2 agent binary to read /proc/*/stat to support
monitoring of haproxy instances.

Change-Id: Ifc3388e894db998bfad8e5998a02120222d9e3ae
Closes-Bug: 1770040
(cherry picked from commit 6e3e557a0a097d79f0eaac9453e45e142fa1a24e)

commit_message:
Add ldap support to grafana, update version, add helm tests

This adds ldap support to the grafana chart. This required updating
the version of Grafana to 5.0, as this version allows for using
configuration files to bootstrap the datasources and dashboards
instead of using the grafana http api. This was a necessary change
as using ldap for grafana presented issues trying to create the
datasource via the http api

This also adds a basic helm test for grafana. This test simply
verifies whether the prometheus datasource configured exists and
whether the number of dashboards reported by the admin api matches
the number of dashboards expected

Change-Id: I2e987cb425adba9f909722ffdb25b83f82710c4d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 13:37:54.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure that the repo servers also use the pypi cache

When re-running openstack-hosts after a greenfield deployment
the repo servers will be reconfigured to make use of the pypi
cache implemented on the repo host. There is therefore no
real reason why it should not be done sooner during the
greenfield deploy - otherwise the deployment is inconsistent.

Also, in a situation where the deployment has no containers,
not implementing the configuration to use the repo pypi cache
results in the rest of the deployment not being able to find
the packages which were built from source. It instead makes
all pip installs go to pypi and never even attempt the cache.

Finally, once the repo build is complete the repo-use playbook

facts to set the default pip index were set prior to the repo
being built, so the reconfiguration leaves the default pip
index to that of pypi. as such, in this patch, we re-verify
and re-set the applicable vars to ensure that the repo is used.

commit_message:
Ensure that the repo servers also use the pypi cache

When re-running openstack-hosts after a greenfield deployment
the repo servers will be reconfigured to make use of the pypi
cache implemented on the repo host. There is therefore no
real reason why it should not be done sooner during the
greenfield deploy - otherwise the deployment is inconsistent.

Also, in a situation where the deployment has no containers,
not implementing the configuration to use the repo pypi cache
results in the rest of the deployment not being able to find
the packages which were built from source. It instead makes
all pip installs go to pypi and never even attempt the cache.

Finally, once the repo build is complete the repo-use playbook
is run to ensure that pip is reconfigured to use it - but the
facts to set the default pip index were set prior to the repo
being built, so the reconfiguration leaves the default pip
index to that of pypi. as such, in this patch, we re-verify
and re-set the applicable vars to ensure that the repo is used.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/563106
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/563111
Change-Id: I2e7f9bc6cbf15b3309f843ffc24b4643563906a0

commit_message:
Correctly detects apache process when mod_perl is installed

Apache mod_perl sets the process name to the full command path
which is truncated to 15 characters by Linux convention. Adds
/usr/sbin/httpd to the apache process known names to the apache
detection plugin.

Change-Id: I6d45e9e6d5aef46d3a230911e7778d6ab7ca9265
story: 2001945
task: 15063

messages:
[{'account_id': 9725, 'date': '2018-03-09 08:17:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-03-09 08:51:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Does the problem you faced just happen because the IP address written into /etc/hosts is different from kube api's advertise address? If so, just changing the advertise address of kubenetes api server (item 2 in the commit message) won't be enough? I don't think changing the IP address written into /etc/hosts makes any difference as we are using kube AIO and all the addresses on your local system can be reachable.

Some comments inline."}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-03-09 08:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9725, 'date': '2018-03-09 09:29:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9725, 'date': '2018-03-09 09:32:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)

As discussed in the IRC channel, I removed the changes related default iface'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-03-09 10:46:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-03-09 12:00:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

After a second thought, I found it is not a good idea to ask users to change contents in /opt/stack/qinling. The qinling source is cloned during the devstack procedure, which means that users don't have to download and put it into /opt/stack. But this change will require a user to download it manually before running devstack. The worse thing is that depending on the devstack settings, the source may be re-cloned and the manual changes will be rollback after the reclone.

I'm thinking to use ansible's ‚Äòenv‚Äô lookup plugin([1] [2]), i.e, export the ADDRESS variable we get in kubeadm/funcs/network.sh then use the env variable in the ansible playbook. This way user don't have to do extra work, just running ./stack.sh should be sufficient.

@Dong Ma, would you try to update this using ansible's env lookup plugin?

[1] http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/faq.html#how-do-i-access-shell-environment-variables
[2] http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/devel/plugins/lookup/env.html"}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-04-04 06:28:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Dong Ma, do you have any plan to update this?'}, {'account_id': 9725, 'date': '2018-04-11 05:48:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Dong Ma, do you have any plan to update this?
Sorry being interrupted by other staffs, I will try to do it in this week'}, {'account_id': 9725, 'date': '2018-05-12 14:17:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-05-14 07:36:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Improve the setup scripts to support multi-nics

This commit improves the setup scripts to support multi-nics:
1. update kube_master playbook to read kubeadm init parameter from
   environment variable
2. add one note into development-environment-devstack doc

Change-Id: Ie5fa11cc0d0b1a4cf5bd388b80a12a3f00295788

commit_message:
Run inventory-manage.py from the ansible-runtime venv

bootstrap-ansible installs prettytables in the ansible-runtime
venv. inventory-manage.py requires prettytables, so should use
the venv.

Change-Id: I5bcc8f78ec8a1a175f0bfae3f38101d26e7e3803

subject: Modified typo on Change Stack's pop-up Window.
messages:
[{'account_id': 27212, 'date': '2018-05-09 05:39:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-05-09 05:40:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-05-09 05:55:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi, thank you for this patch, as you might award, all Heat projects moved from Launchpad to StoryBoard now.
You can find your Story task here
https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/1767266
So please help to add the following message in your commit message to track this patch from StoryBoard:

Story: #1767266
Task: #18912


For more detail, you can find in https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Heat-StoryBoard-Migration-Info
Feel free to reach out to us in irc #heat if any confusion or issues'}, {'account_id': 27212, 'date': '2018-05-09 06:20:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 19224, 'date': '2018-05-09 08:23:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

commit_message:
Modified typo on Change Stack's pop-up Window.

In stack update's pop-up window, the description and form help text is
still using creation, not updating. That's not good.

Change-Id: I81c839f52918da276125f377ea829c3da8b3c4a8
Task: #18912
Story: #1767266

The 2.47 compute API relies on policy rule
os_compute_api:os-flavor-extra-specs:index to determine

response when showing server details, updating a server or
rebuilding a server. This change updates the documentation
for the policy rule to indicate its usage in those APIs.

(cherry picked from commit 8a6722ea9cdcbbee417b092a7261339b73dfe0c4)

commit_message:
Update os_compute_api:os-flavor-extra-specs:index docs for 2.47

The 2.47 compute API relies on policy rule
os_compute_api:os-flavor-extra-specs:index to determine
if flavor extra specs should be shown in the embedded flavor
response when showing server details, updating a server or
rebuilding a server. This change updates the documentation
for the policy rule to indicate its usage in those APIs.

Change-Id: I1116751f2a065edf15ea7d492abde6e01c3e4cdb
Partial-Bug: #1763741
(cherry picked from commit 8a6722ea9cdcbbee417b092a7261339b73dfe0c4)

commit_message:
Avoid writing the archive_toc.rst file

We have code that generates RST, write it to disk to be included.  Let's
avoid the file system and use a directive to just include the RST where
we want it.

Change-Id: Ia6cf51cd548cce97b3de8f2ef42113ef831b13ad

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 14:24:26.000000000', 'message': 'Run identity client relations when db is complete

When keystone is deployed with multiple units but without hacluster one
off scenarios occur where one non-leader unit will fail to update its
client relations.

This change runs all identity client relations when the database
relation is complete thus guaranteeing all keystone units update there
identity relation data with clients.

Small timing fix to amulet tests.

Closes-Bug: #1761562
Change-Id: I338e500dbc155b75c75b9261a9b5b471bd73088a
(cherry picked from commit a240c520a520ca92f338efa3717b2a09f4a7281d)
'}]
commit_message:
Run identity client relations when db is complete

When keystone is deployed with multiple units but without hacluster one
off scenarios occur where one non-leader unit will fail to update its
client relations.

This change runs all identity client relations when the database
relation is complete thus guaranteeing all keystone units update there
identity relation data with clients.

Small timing fix to amulet tests.

Closes-Bug: #1761562
Change-Id: I338e500dbc155b75c75b9261a9b5b471bd73088a
(cherry picked from commit a240c520a520ca92f338efa3717b2a09f4a7281d)

commit_message:
Ensure minimal host facts are present in build

The host may have busted facts for any number of reasons. This change
gathers required facts on the physical_host prior to requiring them.

Change-Id: I0f12bc0b8d5df8840d232853d9aeaecac2688aa6

commit_message:
Fix irrelevant-files in nova-dsvm-multinode-base

The nova-live-migration test hook configuration is in
nova/tests/live_migration/hooks and because of the
irrelevant-files list on the job, changes to those
setup scripts are not self-testing. This change fixes
the regex so we can self-test the nova-live-migration
job changes.

Change-Id: Ia7e35d483f660e98eea5e109e010f77d5419af85

commit_message:
Remove .txt from the filename when getting candidates email address

While we say the filename should be an email address it isn't impossible
that candidates will append .txt, so lets be robust/generous and cope
with that.

Change-Id: I9d18895f5a351ce7404ce1b4a09a7c5f6dce3ad7

subject: Castellan based secret store
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 8623, 'name': 'Kaitlin Farr', 'email': 'kaitlin.farr@jhuapl.edu', 'username': 'kaitlin.farr'}, {'_account_id': 8866, 'name': 'Raildo Mascena de Sousa Filho', 'email': 'rmascena@redhat.com', 'username': 'raildo'}, {'_account_id': 9914, 'name': 'Ade Lee', 'email': 'alee@redhat.com', 'username': 'alee'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11561, 'name': 'Dave McCowan', 'email': 'dmccowan@cisco.com', 'username': 'dave-mccowan'}, {'_account_id': 16046, 'name': 'Fernando Diaz', 'email': 'diazjf@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'diazjf'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27954, 'name': 'Mois√©s Guimar√£es de Medeiros', 'email': 'guimaraes@pm.me', 'username': 'moguimar'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-01-04 20:28:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8623, 'date': '2018-01-05 15:01:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The motivation behind this is to allow the new Castellan drivers like Vault to be used behind Barbican so effort isn't duplicated, right?  I know we talked about this is Denver, and I'm not sure if there was more discussion about this in Sydney.  I think this is going to be really difficult to explain to people, especially seeing how many people get confused about the difference between Castellan and Barbican.  Is the big picture documented anywhere?  A spec?

Some of the Castellan drivers may not be relevant, right? It seems to me like no one's going to want to use Barbican -> Castellan -> Barbican, for example.

One sticking point is that Castellan takes in the oslo config object.  The Barbican config file may get really confusing if all of the castellan config options are added to it.

I still think it would be the least hassle if we just made a VaultSecretStore here.  I hear you on the not wanting to duplicate code, though, so what if, instead of making a generic CastellanSecretStore, you made a VaultSecretStore with its own separate Barbican config options, then convert them in the code to an oslo config object that can be passed to Castellan?"}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-01-05 21:48:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Keitlyn, thanks for the feedback.  Exactly the kind of feedback I was hoping for.

Its a tricky balance to minimize the work needed to use a new castellan backend as a barbican secret store vs. keeping the secret store configuration consistent and understandable.

The way I have it now - all you need to do to use a castellan backend as a secret store is :
1) enable the castellan_plugin secret store
2) add the [key_manager] and [...] sections you would ordinarily add  
   to use the castellan plugin to begin with.

The pro of this is that there is no additional coding required.  The downside is that is inconsistent for the config model we already have for secret store plugins.  It also breaks multiple secret store support in the sense that you could only have one type of castellan secret store.

A variant of what you suggest is as follows:

1) Create CastellanSecretStore as an abstract class.  We would have an abstract method get_conf(self, conf) which would be implemented by the subclass, and would take the config provided and return the proper oslo.config object to be passed to key_manager.API(conf)

2) Create a subclass VaultSecretStore which will take config options from its own con Barbican config options - and turn them into the relevant oslo.config object.

3) this subclass could also override generate_supports() and store_supports() as needed.

The pro for this approach is that it would be consistent with other secret stores, while keeping in code reuse.  

The disadvantage is that we would need to add a new class which replicates the castellan options (and may have to be kept in sync) for each castellan plugin.

I think the second solution is cleaner - and its on as if castellan plugins are rolling off the shelves ..'}, {'account_id': 11561, 'date': '2018-01-09 16:41:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think we're on the right path here, allowing re-use of future Castellan keystores as Barbican keystores.  Definitely keep in mind the continuation of multiple backend support, and the flexibility of a future variety of credentials for different secret stores."}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-05-08 20:47:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-05-09 15:30:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-05-14 05:44:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-05-14 15:31:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-05-14 16:21:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2018-05-14 17:22:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-05-14 17:29:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11561, 'date': '2018-05-14 17:59:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-05-15 02:17:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Castellan based secret store

This will provide a Castellan based secret store, which will
allow secret stores which have a castellan backend to be used
behind barbican.  The initial example of this is the Vault
backend.

Unit tests have been added.  In local tests,
most of the functional tests do in fact pass with a local Vault
backend, though this will need to be demonstrated with a later
review which establishes a Vault based gate.

Change-Id: Ib30fb79304014592bfc37938839d60a4c10c244d

commit_message:
Update "auth_url" in install docs

Following the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url" in docs.

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

sahara-extra does not actually have any functional changes. Are you including that just for the sake of bumping all packages versions?'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-05-13 21:57:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Yes, that's what we usually did.
Now I realize that we discussed it in the past (see the comments in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544279/ ) and I'm not sure at this point."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-05-13 21:58:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

OK, just wanted to confirm and make sure there wasn't something overlooked. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2018-05-14 14:44:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-05-15 03:52:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Requesting release of Sahara Queens 8.0.1

There were many bugs found on image generation that needed backporting
and made necessary a new queens version to be released.

commit_message:
Openstack-Exporter: Remove personal image reference

This changes the prometheus-openstack-exporter image to point to
a new image in quay.io/attcomdev rather than a personal image
repository

Change-Id: Ibf4fb74b38842d8cd52df7d0c9871aa58366b827

commit_message:
Add ldap support in elasticsearch/kibana apache proxies

This adds required configuration for enabling LDAP through
the apache proxy in the elasticsearch and kibana charts by
default

Change-Id: Iaff8f328ff50944ddad94ec86b1134ca73750176

we should make this depend on removing the chart from osh, and also coordinate with other projects making use of this chart (eg Keystone?)'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2018-05-09 18:15:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23:

> we should make this depend on removing the chart from osh, and also
 > coordinate with other projects making use of this chart (eg
 > Keystone?)

Would it make more sense to have the removal of the chart from OSH depend on this change? In my mind, if that depends on this change, then we can verify the chart here works for keystone. I wasn't sure how that dependency would work exactly, but that seemed to make more sense since osh-infra is a dependent project for osh (allowing this ldap chart to be present as part of the runs for the change to remove it from osh). Or am I misunderstanding how the depends-on link works?"}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-05-09 19:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

> > we should make this depend on removing the chart from osh, and
 > also
 > > coordinate with other projects making use of this chart (eg
 > > Keystone?)
 > 
 > Would it make more sense to have the removal of the chart from OSH
 > depend on this change? In my mind, if that depends on this change,
 > then we can verify the chart here works for keystone. I wasn't sure
 > how that dependency would work exactly, but that seemed to make
 > more sense since osh-infra is a dependent project for osh (allowing
 > this ldap chart to be present as part of the runs for the change to
 > remove it from osh). Or am I misunderstanding how the depends-on
 > link works?

I believe there is also a "Needed-By" footer, but not sure if zuul does anything beyond "Depends-On". I however agree that it should be done too to ensure that ldap-job doesn't fail in OSH as the result of this move.'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2018-05-10 18:58:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24: Patch Set 23 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-05-11 08:28:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

commit_message:
LDAP: Move ldap chart to openstack-helm-infra

This moves the ldap chart to openstack-helm-infra from
openstack-helm, allowing for ldap to provide an authentication
mechanism for components of the LMA stack, and can still be used for
keystone in openstack-helm, as openstack-helm-infra is a required
project

Change-Id: I211bc47c7a3ae875614102c8f64daa1099f702e8

[{'created': '2018-03-05 16:44:31.000000000', 'message': 'node-exporter: use endpoints section and lookups to set port

commit_message:
node-exporter: use endpoints section and lookups to set port

This PS moves node-exporter to use the endpoints section and
lookups to set the ports it serves on.

Change-Id: Id6d71b12e531375e792384ac4410bce74170d033

Nice!'}, {'account_id': 15993, 'date': '2017-11-30 03:29:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-11-30 06:38:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

But without serialisation won't all the nodes be upgraded at once - causing an outage during that process?"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-11-30 15:13:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-11-30 18:01:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

[{'created': '2017-11-18 05:33:11.000000000', 'message': "Improve the speed of execution for Galera

With the recent improvements in the galera role and the ability to
execute a proper WSREP check we can drop the serialization within this
playbook. The loadbalancer, when running the new wsrep check, will
ensure we're only ever communicating with an active and sync'd node.

Change-Id: Ic67ec8e23595630dd589ded0f5fdf9ace7110248
Depends-On: If189a8192f22aafb168587361ca8e6903c918697

commit_message:
Improve the speed of execution for Galera

With the recent improvements in the galera role and the ability to
execute a proper WSREP check we can drop the serialization within this
playbook. The loadbalancer, when running the new wsrep check, will
ensure we're only ever communicating with an active and sync'd node.

Change-Id: Ic67ec8e23595630dd589ded0f5fdf9ace7110248
Depends-On: If189a8192f22aafb168587361ca8e6903c918697
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add s3api support

Add s3api ans s3token middleware to enable
support in TripleO by default

commit_message:
Include docker and undercloud environments first

When we deploy the undercloud, the command we use should include the
docker.yaml and undercloud.yaml environments earlier in the deployment
command so we can override the defaults later on.

Change-Id: Ic7dba7e548f85574cce2db23e3fec5c8ea761bb7
Related-Blueprint: containerized-undercloud

commit_message:
Enable default polling interval override

By default collectd polling interval is set to 10 seconds for all plugins,
which is bringing down the entire cloud if the default Gnocchi deployment
(Swift on controllers) is used. We have to override the default higher value.

Closes-Bug: #1771083
Change-Id: I210c72028da35068ed8469b2d2deb75797a2b08f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-15 00:42:06.000000000', 'message': 'Update role to gate using all supported distros

The changes here remove the boiler plate code we had in favor of using
all of our common roles. This also updates the nspawn role using some of
the learnings we've had from our recent LXC changes and ensures we're
not breaking any compatibility we had with our various distros.

Add option to run a full config update if required

> As a deployer I need the ability to make a sweeping change to container
  configs if required. At present the nspawn container create role will
  attempt to preserve the configs and update only what's required, which
  is desirable when maintaining uptime. This change provides the option
  `nspawn_container_preserve_config` which, if set to "false" will
  template the container configs instead of trying to preserve it.

Document everything in config

Change-Id: Ie969c10578e1102767ad8991c9d6171b547aef87
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Update role to gate using all supported distros

The changes here remove the boiler plate code we had in favor of using
all of our common roles. This also updates the nspawn role using some of
the learnings we've had from our recent LXC changes and ensures we're
not breaking any compatibility we had with our various distros.

Add option to run a full config update if required

> As a deployer I need the ability to make a sweeping change to container
  configs if required. At present the nspawn container create role will
  attempt to preserve the configs and update only what's required, which
  is desirable when maintaining uptime. This change provides the option
  `nspawn_container_preserve_config` which, if set to "false" will
  template the container configs instead of trying to preserve it.

Document everything in config

Change-Id: Ie969c10578e1102767ad8991c9d6171b547aef87
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Update auth_uri option to www_authenticate_uri

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken

Change-Id: If96d9296196ba64dbead5ee0e55d8ba1f8c642ed

commit_message:
Update "auth_url" in install docs

Following the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url" in docs.

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

In addition, update deprecated "auth_uri" to "www_authenticate_uri",
according to [6].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932
[6] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522

Change-Id: Id145435a48b13ba2aedf0c2ef8e7fc49006aff17

commit_message:
Check status code when downloading empty file

According to
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/#download-binary-image-data
The status code of Glance API is 204 when downloading empty file, so
this patch adds the corresponding check on a test.

This patch comes from I6eef7231742d873a0e727c300a9ae7f5958ac4f8

Change-Id: Ia45b584e3783c6ab6d7c94a817da9b5058f1c351
Related-Bug: #1756264

commit_message:
Populate project info before using it

Sorting and filtering will rely on the attributes information. It is
necessary to populate project info before using it to sort/filter.

Closes-Bug: #1765452
Change-Id: Ife90268530b6e86a0b0d213e4742a2ef81cb2395

'description'. This indicates that these two attributes can be used
as filter parameters for standard resources. In the future, we will

commit_message:
Annotate filter parameters for standard attributes

Add 'is_filter' keyword for attributes 'revision_number' and
'description'. This indicates that these two attributes can be used
as filter parameters for standard resources. In the future, we will
rely on this to perform filter validation:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554368/

Change-Id: I847a849720297fb6b316098e278fa5c71dd1010a
Related-Bug: #1749820

commit_message:
Return resource providers without inventories

To support nested provider allocation candidates, we agreed that
the placement service returns all providers in a particular provider
tree that match the search criteria so that callers can use this
hierarchy information in making further sorting or filtering
decisions.

However, the hierarchy is not complete since provider_summaries
didn't include providers that have no inventory.

This patch fixes it to include all the providers in the tree
using outer join instead of inner join in _get_usages_by_provider.

Change-Id: Id1a33afe4ad6a501e1de7ca03086c4ca4b6872a2
Blueprint: placement-return-all-resources

subject: Add customized mem/cpu in qinling server
messages:
[{'account_id': 27695, 'date': '2018-04-12 12:05:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27695, 'date': '2018-04-13 03:29:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

1. tempest failed because runtime is not available when test to create runtime, which is due to the deployment.j2 updating and 'cglimit' image not be pushed to docker hub 'openstackqinling/cglimit'.
2. Currently, 'cgroup' directory will be created under /sys/fs/cgroup/memory/ on host when we create runtime, so we may need to rmdir the directory when we delete runtime. But the directory can be removed by only root or sudo user. So I want to use 'os.system('sudo rmdir PATH')' to remove the directory, however it will need password then.
So, I think if we should ask deployers to set 'stack' user to be sudo user and NOPASSWD?"}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-04-13 03:30:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

hi, jiangyuan, thanks for the contribution. Just let you know, it's probably a good idea to split a huge patch into some reasonable small ones in future, so life will be easier for the reviewers :-) That's ok you keep this patch as is, just some suggestion for your future contribution."}, {'account_id': 27695, 'date': '2018-04-13 04:10:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 12:05:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add customized mem/cpu in qinling server

When creating package/swift/image type functions, allow users to specify cpu
and memory_size resources for the functions.

Main ideas base on spec doc from "doc/source/specs/customize_resource.rst".
Some explanations about using 'cgroup' in runtime server are as following:

- According to one container on service, so use one another container
  'cglimit' to set cpu and memory resource limitation to relevant cgroup
  files for 'server' container, but tasks file will not be shared between
  containers.
- Though qinling has jurisdiction over tasks files in current 'server'
  container, onece we put function pid into one tasks file, function will
  never be able to remove its pid or its child processes' pids from this tasks
  file and qinling can not delete 'cgroup' files include tasks file.
- Each pod in deployment will has respective 'cgroup' directory, whose name
  will be the same as 'server' container's hostname(worker pod name), under
  memory and cpu subsystem.

Change-Id: Iab8bab5218e824af36dd50d8343dd2e0fcac7df7
Story: 2001586
Task: 6535
'}, {'created': '2018-04-14 15:35:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add customized mem/cpu in qinling server

cpu and memory_size resources for the functions.

Main ideas base on doc from "doc/source/specs/customize_resource.rst".
Some explanations about using 'cgroup' in runtime server are as

  will never be able to remove its pid or its child processes' pids
  from this 'tasks' file and qinling can not delete 'cgroup' files,

- Each pod in deployment will has respective 'cgroup' directory, whose

Change-Id: Iab8bab5218e824af36dd50d8343dd2e0fcac7df7
Story: 2001586
Task: 6535

commit_message:
Add customized mem/cpu in qinling server

When creating package/swift/image type functions, allow users to specify
cpu and memory_size resources for the functions.

Main ideas base on doc from "doc/source/specs/customize_resource.rst".
Some explanations about using 'cgroup' in runtime server are as
following:

- According to one container on service, so use one another container
  'cglimit' to set cpu and memory resource limitation to relevant
  'cgroup' files for 'runtime' container, but 'tasks' file will not be
  shared between containers.
- Though qinling has jurisdiction over tasks files in current 'runtime'
  container, once we put function pid into one tasks file, function
  will never be able to remove its pid or its child processes' pids
  from this 'tasks' file and qinling can not delete 'cgroup' files,
  include 'tasks' file.
- Each pod in deployment will has respective 'cgroup' directory, whose
  name will be set to the same as 'runtime' container's hostname(worker
  pod name), under memory and cpu 'cgroup' subsystem.

Change-Id: Iab8bab5218e824af36dd50d8343dd2e0fcac7df7
Story: 2001586
Task: 6535

commit_message:
Use Designate Worker container for config

During the config phase we need to run some BIND-related configuration
processes, and they aren't present in the API container.

bp designate-support

Change-Id: I1bbf7479811c825731c0f84939656d13cf0f904c

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks

    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know

    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

commit_message:
Document everything in config

Update container pkg list and use qgroups

Other roles within OSA require additional packages that were removed
from the base cache. This change puts those packages back.

Additionally this change implements qgroups which will resolve an issue
where the containers are spamming a reoccuring error message indicating
an issue with the loopback file system.

Change-Id: If658e5f332e4580cc51182ac92331a2ef91fbcb8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Update container pkg list and use qgroups

Other roles within OSA require additional packages that were removed
from the base cache. This change puts those packages back.

Additionally this change implements qgroups which will resolve an issue
where the containers are spamming a reoccuring error message indicating
an issue with the loopback file system.

Change-Id: I619760d2a1dd9722c8d8e1d70482632163d07c31
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Remove token driver configuration

The "driver" configuration should be removed with the removal of
uuid token. Keystone now doesn't support persistence token.

Change-Id: Ibea6660cd85c07abc9c4bc011180c08dd5017ced
bp: removed-as-of-rocky

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-01 13:45:51.000000000', 'message': 'Modify revert tests to account for creating volumes != 1GB

Some backends cannot create volumes in sizes of 1GB,
such as ScaleIO. In that case, ensure volumes are created
and extended in multiples of what they can support.

Change-Id: I92a317e025b37efa09713ecf4ec254fabbff3437
'}]
commit_message:
Modify revert tests to account for creating volumes != 1GB

Some backends cannot create volumes in sizes of 1GB,
such as ScaleIO. In that case, ensure volumes are created
and extended in multiples of what they can support.

Change-Id: I92a317e025b37efa09713ecf4ec254fabbff3437

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24454, 'name': 'suguangfeng', 'email': 'suguangfeng@inspur.com', 'username': 'suguangfeng'}, {'_account_id': 26458, 'name': 'Brin Zhang', 'email': 'zhangbailin@inspur.com', 'username': 'zhangbailin'}, {'_account_id': 27248, 'name': 'Prateek Goel', 'email': 'prateek.goel2@tatacommunications.com', 'username': 'prateek.goel'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-01-31 10:38:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-02-02 04:59:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Uploaded patch set 1.
Looked at choose_best_location which calls get_ordered_locations in location_order.py and store_type.py and it appears that none of them will be able to return None and hence choose_best_location not return None. Reason being, location_order.py just returns locations we pass it, and check for locations not None is already done before calling choose_best_location. For store_type.py, the return variable "ret" is initialized to ret = [].
So, I am not sure if, this is needed.'}, {'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-02-02 05:05:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-02-02 06:51:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi,Prateek Goel.Thank you for reviewing my code.
I understand what you mean, but the processing logic here is questionable, and since location can not be None, why is there a "return None" logic in get_ordered_locations?
Even if I do not handle this return in _format_image, I also need to remove the handling of "else" in choose_best_location.
So I think the update here is necessary.'}, {'account_id': 24454, 'date': '2018-02-02 07:06:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I agree BrinÔºåthis update is necessary.'}, {'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-02-02 07:36:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

> Hi,Prateek Goel.Thank you for reviewing my code.
 > I understand what you mean, but the processing logic here is
 > questionable, and since location can not be None, why is there a
 > "return None" logic in get_ordered_locations?
 > Even if I do not handle this return in _format_image, I also need
 > to remove the handling of "else" in choose_best_location.
 > So I think the update here is necessary.

Hi Brin,
        You are right. Just that, it got me thinking that we might have lots of places similar to this which may need fix. :) 
Anyways, I change my view and I am for this change.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-02-02 07:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Prateek.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-02-06 04:47:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Comment inline.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-05-14 15:27:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Agree with Brian. Should this be abandoned?'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-05-15 00:47:27.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

'}, {'created': '2018-05-13 08:16:10.000000000', 'message': "Update role to gate using all supported distros

The changes here remove the boiler plate code we had in favor of using
all of our common roles. This also updates the nspawn role using some of
the learnings we've had from our recent LXC changes and ensures we're
not breaking any compatibility we had with our various distros.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/c/549403
Change-Id: Ibb758b2e5a7f8bccffe307932aa4f472687f7acb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-05-13 08:17:40.000000000', 'message': "Update role to gate using all supported distros

The changes here remove the boiler plate code we had in favor of using
all of our common roles. This also updates the nspawn role using some of
the learnings we've had from our recent LXC changes and ensures we're
not breaking any compatibility we had with our various distros.

The changes here remove the boiler plate code we had in favor of using
all of our common roles. This also updates the nspawn role using some of
the learnings we've had from our recent LXC changes and ensures we're
not breaking any compatibility we had with our various distros.

Add option to run a full config update if required

> As a deployer I need the ability to make a sweeping change to container
  configs if required. At present the nspawn container create role will
  attempt to preserve the configs and update only what's required, which
  is desirable when maintaining uptime. This change provides the option
  `nspawn_container_preserve_config` which, if set to "false" will
  template the container configs instead of trying to preserve it.

Change-Id: Ibb758b2e5a7f8bccffe307932aa4f472687f7acb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update role to gate using all supported distros

The changes here remove the boiler plate code we had in favor of using
all of our common roles. This also updates the nspawn role using some of
the learnings we've had from our recent LXC changes and ensures we're
not breaking any compatibility we had with our various distros.

Add option to run a full config update if required

> As a deployer I need the ability to make a sweeping change to container
  configs if required. At present the nspawn container create role will
  attempt to preserve the configs and update only what's required, which
  is desirable when maintaining uptime. This change provides the option
  `nspawn_container_preserve_config` which, if set to "false" will
  template the container configs instead of trying to preserve it.

Change-Id: Ibb758b2e5a7f8bccffe307932aa4f472687f7acb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

This commit also updates the kubernetes client requirement.

commit_message:
kubernetes: add V1DeleteOptions when deleting services

delete_namespaced_service() now takes an required body (delete option)
parameter in the newly released Kubernetes client 6.0.0 [1]. This is not
backward compatible so this commit fixes that by adding the new required
parameter.

NOTE: the requirement of the kubernetes client will be updated by a
following change to avoid requirements check with this one.

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes-client/python/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v600b1

Change-Id: I751691b356bf1ca2e43838bb341e0455286e6a1f

messages: [{'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2018-05-14 22:29:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-05-14 22:45:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-05-14 22:51:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 22:29:17.000000000', 'message': "Update prometheus rule for terminated containers in pods

This updates the prometheus rule for checking for terminated
containers in pods. The previous rule checked for any terminations,
which raised alarms due to completed containers in jobs
being included, which isn't desired behavior. This changes the
expression to check for any containers that have terminated with
a status other than completed

Change-Id: I88e533a56f81f81bd1a81420ecfb7d43ac9e2d0b
"}]
commit_message:
Update prometheus rule for terminated containers in pods

This updates the prometheus rule for checking for terminated
containers in pods. The previous rule checked for any terminations,
which raised alarms due to completed containers in jobs
being included, which isn't desired behavior. This changes the
expression to check for any containers that have terminated with
a status other than completed

Change-Id: I88e533a56f81f81bd1a81420ecfb7d43ac9e2d0b

commit_message:
Allow OVA upload for images

Bug #1641383 was not fixed for REST API call.
The two implementation of create_image_metadata are merged
into api/glance.py.

There were minor differences in field naming and handling
(min_ vs minimum_, is_public vs public vs visibility).
This commit normalizes them to simplify the logic.

Closes-Bug: #1757136
Change-Id: I41e9d94345151bc4473d704cdc040ed77870ce45
(cherry picked from commit e3626260313c87aba6d9579c81f8dac415cc7235)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 20:57:11.000000000', 'message': "Don't install kolla

This role should really be focused on creating a working docker and
registry, and installing kolla is not really related to that.

Even in CI, if container modifications are required it is more likely
to happen via modifying existing images with
ansible-role-tripleo-modify-image, which doesn't involve the kolla
package.

Change-Id: I7ba8d89b75f206aa92bdfd907712b1b0b44a4c32
"}]
commit_message:
Don't install kolla

This role should really be focused on creating a working docker and
registry, and installing kolla is not really related to that.

Even in CI, if container modifications are required it is more likely
to happen via modifying existing images with
ansible-role-tripleo-modify-image, which doesn't involve the kolla
package.

Change-Id: I7ba8d89b75f206aa92bdfd907712b1b0b44a4c32

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 21:07:07.000000000', 'message': 'Improve mocking in REST API tests (test_glance)

The current REST API tests have a lot of rooms to be improved like:
- mocking the whole module of the API wrapper

---
[Note on a backport to queens]

This is a preparation of a backport proposed in [1].
mock usage of api.rest.test_glance was improved in Rocky and
the test backported in [1] assumes the improved version of the test.
This is a test improvement which does not touch the main code,
so it is a safe backport.

The signature of create_mocks was changed in [2], so the arguments
of create_mocks in this backport are adjusted to Queens version.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566267/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545472/

Change-Id: Id573d97c467fe8457f60baff089d60c18345395e
Partial-Bug: #1752917
(cherry picked from commit dfa68461ea9d6599809d623bccbf2b5ddb9faec9)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve mocking in REST API tests (test_glance)

The current REST API tests have a lot of rooms to be improved like:
- mocking the whole module of the API wrapper

---
[Note on a backport to queens]

This is a preparation of a backport proposed in [1].
mock usage of api.rest.test_glance was improved in Rocky and
the test backported in [1] assumes the improved version of the test.
This is a test improvement which does not touch the main code,
so it is a safe backport.

The signature of create_mocks was changed in [2], so the arguments
of create_mocks in this backport are adjusted to Queens version.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566267/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545472/

Change-Id: Id573d97c467fe8457f60baff089d60c18345395e
Partial-Bug: #1752917

commit_message:
Remove '_apply_instance_name_template'

Support for the 'multi_instance_display_name_template' option was
removed in commit 0e43002c9 and booting multiple instances now will
simply result in a simple numerical suffix (-1, -2, -3, ...) being added
to the instance's 'display_name' and 'hostname' attributes.

In that commit, it was noted that there was a lot more cleanup that
could be done in this area. The change gets that ball rolling by
squashing the '_apply_instance_name_template' function into
'_populate_instance_names'. This doesn't do much itself, but it allows
us to simplify a future change to remove much of the now-unnecessary
complexity of this feature.

Change-Id: I57ddfca39d9b76ac0cabf994d8a825a35b6d6e19

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 14:36:19.000000000', 'message': 'Update tests to work with WebOb 1.8.1

WebOb recently changed how they validate Accept-* headers [0] to
closely follow the definitions in RFC 7231 Section 5.3.2 [1].

WebOb now checks the actual value of the Accept-Language header and
compares it to a regular expression. This caused a couple keystone
unit tests to fail because we were generating random UUIDs for
Accept-Language testing just to make sure the logic within keystone
was behaving properly. The UUID format actual fails the new regular
expression being used by WebOb to validate the Accept-Language
header.

This commit changes the tests to use a language header that passes
the new validation put in place by WebOb.

[0] https://docs.pylonsproject.org/projects/webob/en/stable/whatsnew-1.8.html#backwards-incompatibilities
[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231.html#section-5.3.2

Change-Id: Ic53f4d00bc6c8dec08ec1bff589a91ff359276e1
Closes-Bug: 1765748

[0] https://docs.pylonsproject.org/projects/webob/en/stable/whatsnew-1.8.html#backwards-incompatibilities
[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231.html#section-5.3.2

Change-Id: Ic53f4d00bc6c8dec08ec1bff589a91ff359276e1
Closes-Bug: 1765748
'}]
commit_message:
Update tests to work with WebOb 1.8.1

WebOb recently changed how they validate Accept-* headers [0] to
closely follow the definitions in RFC 7231 Section 5.3.2 [1].

WebOb now checks the actual value of the Accept-Language header and
compares it to a regular expression. This caused a couple keystone
unit tests to fail because we were generating random UUIDs for
Accept-Language testing just to make sure the logic within keystone
was behaving properly. The UUID format actual fails the new regular
expression being used by WebOb to validate the Accept-Language
header.

This commit changes the tests to use a language header that passes
the new validation put in place by WebOb.

[0] https://docs.pylonsproject.org/projects/webob/en/stable/whatsnew-1.8.html#backwards-incompatibilities
[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231.html#section-5.3.2

Change-Id: Ic53f4d00bc6c8dec08ec1bff589a91ff359276e1
Closes-Bug: 1765748

commit_message:
Add VERSION and WIKI_NAME to NEC driver

The actual driver class needs to have these set in order to
get pulled out for reporting like in:

https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/drivers.html#mstoragefcdriver

This adds VERSION and WIKI_NAME to the MStorage driver class.

Change-Id: I33ce94e679d5825afd9f41309ee9bb454e0473ae

commit_message:
Add reno to test-requirements

Reno was moved over to doc/requirements.txt when that was created
because it is needed for releasenotes builds. But with its removal
from the other requirements files, doing something like the
recommended "tox -e venv -- reno new xxx" to create a new release
note fails with reno missing from any venv's created since it was
removed.

This adds reno back in to test-requirements.txt so it is installed
when creating the venv, ummm... venv.

Change-Id: Id2e0325b0ce8e18bb9a65318fb3fc52777753536

Since kernel v4.6, virtio balloon driver commit 5057dcd0f
introduced metric VIRTIO_BALLOON_S_AVAIL,
corresponding to 'Available' in /proc/meminfo.
Libvirt exposed this metric as 'usable'.

As 'Available' of meminfo is an estimate of how much memory
is available for starting new applications, without swapping.

commit_message:
inspector: memory: use usable of memoryStats if available

Since kernel v4.6, virtio balloon driver commit 5057dcd0f
introduced metric VIRTIO_BALLOON_S_AVAIL,
corresponding to 'Available' in /proc/meminfo.
Libvirt exposed this metric as 'usable'.

As 'Available' of meminfo is an estimate of how much memory
is available for starting new applications, without swapping.

It's a better metric for calculating memory_usage.

Change-Id: I3b935f1fc2ed74ca45b26990c4f2bd5996e1dfea
Signed-off-by: Chen Hanxiao <chenhx@certusnet.com.cn>

commit_message:
Make the KeystoneURL stack output versionless

Given that we have now moved all of the places where the keystone auth
URL is used to be versionless. We now make the KeystoneURL output to be
versionless as well.

Story: #2001897
Change-Id: I8c9fbfc77fe47e3ed2e58eac27119f86a045483c

commit_message:
Add compute node L3 agent container for DVR

Neutron OVS DVR requires a L3 agent container with a special
configuration on the compute node.

Change-Id: Iab06c11de90b8ebc7dc6bd946367e5693a4a0f71
Closes-Bug: #1717316

commit_message:
Run yum clean to reduce size of docker image layer

This ensures we do not write the yum cache in the layer, making the
image size smaller.

Change-Id: I974bcac75be9231cf282a73db1a22a6f4ba079fc

commit_message:
Remove explicit --config-download

Now that config-download is the default across tripleoclient and
tripleo-heat-templates, we can update all the CI jobs to remove the
explicit --config-download and -e
environments/config-download-environment.yaml.

Note that --deployed-server didn't actually trigger any needed behaviors
with --config-download, so where it was used, it has now been removed as
well.

Change-Id: Ic5c5df350a7eb5291d45cf8e229af575fe9bed57

subject: Add option to run a full config update if required
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 19:30:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add option to run a full config update if required

As a deployer I need the ability to make a sweeping change to container
configs if required. At present the nspawn container create role will
attempt to preserve the configs and update only what's required, which
is desirable when maintaining uptime. This change provides the option
`nspawn_container_preserve_config` which, if set to "false" will
template the container configs instead of trying to preserve it.

Change-Id: Ifc1c8873d69b146df7f9863c0c5116f3a51eaeff
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to run a full config update if required

As a deployer I need the ability to make a sweeping change to container
configs if required. At present the nspawn container create role will
attempt to preserve the configs and update only what's required, which
is desirable when maintaining uptime. This change provides the option
`nspawn_container_preserve_config` which, if set to "false" will
template the container configs instead of trying to preserve it.

Change-Id: Ifc1c8873d69b146df7f9863c0c5116f3a51eaeff
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

The Octavia public key configuration is run by Mistral meaning under the
'mistral' user. The previously default /home/stack/.ssh/id_rsa.pub file

commit_message:
Default Octavia SSH pub key to UC default keypair

The Octavia public key configuration is run by Mistral meaning under the
'mistral' user. The previously default /home/stack/.ssh/id_rsa.pub file
may not be readable or not accessible because the of lack of permissions
from its parent directory leading to permission denied and hence failure
to deploy overcloud. It is safer to not default to a file path but to
use the existing 'default' keypair from the undercloud which anyway is
the public key of the 'stack' user. Users can still specify a file path
but will need to ensure it is readable.

Related-Bug: #1770641
Change-Id: I1dea4a8d5bb3c5a64ee7fb8995b837909bc1cafe

commit_message:
Check pub key file perms and default to pub key data

The previously default /home/stack/.ssh/id_rsa.pub file may not exist or
be readable; exit with explicit error message. Users can still specify a
file path but will need to ensure it is readable. Should a file path not
be specified, default to amp_ssh_key_data. The value is passed by THT
with the public key of the 'default' keypair from the undercloud which
anyway is the public key of the 'stack' user.

This patch also fixes a syntax error in octavia-undercloud role.

Closes-Bug: #1770153
Closes-Bug: #1770641

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/568022
Change-Id: I0026343d90b84572c3002fa21001cfb09c742391

commit_message:
Convert CLI options to variables for updates/upgrades/ffwd.

Some cli options like --ntp-server/--control-scaler have variables
e.g.: NtpServer or RoleFlavor/Count.
It makes sense to convert them to env file and use it in follow up
 update/upgrade/ffwd operations, rather then maintain a list of cli
options.

Change-Id: Ie1305b8783de403fe0c725b1207782dd8336c053
(cherry picked from commit c60e7a964cca019d4f44d5b3a9a17c784bbc50d7)

commit_message:
Allow running update/upgrade converge with --update-plan-only

We discovered we need to put back stack updates into the converge
operations. This increases the run time of the upgrade procedure
considerably, and e.g. our voting CI job for updates might go over the
time limit. We'll need to start passing --update-plan-only to the
converge operation to keep CI on previous run times.

Depends-On: Idc5dbebc116aba2420d275aab3981186511f298e
Change-Id: I9039db99f43e8ad091ea6fef7e3a149fcddf1334
Related-Bug: #1768586
(cherry picked from commit dea69896c441d0d562513d93b60cb6b2e18c22f7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 19:25:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add task to regather facts once the role completes

In order to ensure the deployment host has the most up-to-date facts we
must regather them upon the completion of the role. This is done because
the role will run several tasks that can perform a state change on
various resources and we need to capture the most current state. This is
especially important when running in an environment that makes use of
cached facts.

Change-Id: I429485eba7e4e6643d10d0f3826471f47aab87fc
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add task to regather facts once the role completes

In order to ensure the deployment host has the most up-to-date facts we
must regather them upon the completion of the role. This is done because
the role will run several tasks that can perform a state change on
various resources and we need to capture the most current state. This is
especially important when running in an environment that makes use of
cached facts.

Change-Id: I429485eba7e4e6643d10d0f3826471f47aab87fc
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

I added this change after testing the script into RDO cloud, where it's quite common to get a "500 No hosts available" due to lack of resources available. (1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-02-22 18:07:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Maybe to be discussed with ci squad, but there are many parameter that could/should be overridden.  All the network related one comes to my mind.  The current one are hardcoded with rdo-cloud value making that tool unusable on other openstack cloud.

I think that a "-e extra_parameter.yaml" option could let the user override all the necessary option without adding every parameter as an option ?

WDYT ?'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-02-23 09:20:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Maybe to be discussed with ci squad, but there are many parameter
 > that could/should be overridden.  All the network related one comes
 > to my mind.  The current one are hardcoded with rdo-cloud value
 > making that tool unusable on other openstack cloud.
 > 
 > I think that a "-e extra_parameter.yaml" option could let the user
 > override all the necessary option without adding every parameter as
 > an option ?
 > 
 > WDYT ?

Well, that makes total sense. In that way the user can configure most of the deployment parameters without changing too much the script. As this way we would end up adding more and more variables...
I am going to give it a try to the implementation, although it would be good to get some feedback from the CI squad, as maybe there are some other reasons we're not considering to not doing it via passing a parameters file.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-02-23 10:58:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-02-23 11:11:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-02-23 11:19:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

flavor depending on your cloud resources
available.

commit_message:
Include extra_params option in reproducer-quickstart.sh.

This patch adds the option of overriding the
parameters used for provisioning [0] the
multinode stack. The newly added option
--extra-params/-e allows you to pass different
values for the instances flavor or networking
parameters.

By adding this option we provide flexibility at
the time of running the reproducer script in
other cloud environments.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/blob/master/roles/multinodes/templates/stack.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1769532

commit_message:
Add os_blazar to OpenStack-Ansible

The os_blazar role is necessary for some deployers, so we
want to include this new role to get new contributions. This will
be as a separate deliverable as the main openstack-ansible project,
like others extra roles before it.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566540/
Change-Id: Ife2853269842cdcf4936334f019fee16463a5d80
