revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 14:52:27.000000000', 'message': 'move the team badge generation to the end of the build

Newer versions of Sphinx load the extensions before creating any of
the output directories, so the os.mkdir() call in the badge extension
was failing. Fix the problem by tying the badge step to the
build-finished event Sphinx emits when it reaches the end of its
build.

This change also uncaps Sphinx in the requirements file, since that
cap is not honored in the CI job anyway.

Change-Id: Ia6c232c5bc8c4015e00efe0b3b4182da2490acc7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
move the team badge generation to the end of the build

Newer versions of Sphinx load the extensions before creating any of
the output directories, so the os.mkdir() call in the badge extension
was failing. Fix the problem by tying the badge step to the
build-finished event Sphinx emits when it reaches the end of its
build.

This change also uncaps Sphinx in the requirements file, since that
cap is not honored in the CI job anyway.

Change-Id: Ia6c232c5bc8c4015e00efe0b3b4182da2490acc7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 21:19:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix sphinx-docs job for sphinx >1.7

Upper requirements recently bumped sphinx from 1.6.5 to 1.7.4 which
breaks our docs job. This switches the apidocs build to use
sphinxcontrib.apidoc.

Change-Id: If6b9aa070d37f2799623a24a8e18666b13ef9044
'}]
commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for sphinx >1.7

Upper requirements recently bumped sphinx from 1.6.5 to 1.7.4 which
breaks our docs job. This switches the apidocs build to use
sphinxcontrib.apidoc.

Change-Id: If6b9aa070d37f2799623a24a8e18666b13ef9044

commit_message:
unit test fix: fix api_extension_path being overriden

For some reason I don't understand, api_extension_path ends up
being rewritten between two unit tests.

This is a workaround to unbreak CI.

Change-Id: I930343e7c5d63c02a75bca284be30d5a3df05791
Partial-Bug: 1771107

commit_message:
Add support for using distribution packages for OpenStack services

Distributions provide packages for the OpenStack services so we add
support for using these instead of the pip ones.

Depends-On: I5a78e2120e596d36629b4ba978b2b5df76b149b0
Depends-On: Ib64dcbc960df7d369d202ce8cf7bdc29b3ee0e0a
Depends-On: Id9dd2dea146709414ab9ce8d439f1587e6776fd4
Depends-On: I2ba89e25c0010c9a5b515a3d0c9c731b30876e74
Depends-On: I0442b0aa94c3d0882d1118ad0c824d123bd21c88
Change-Id: I26848678dd07a409ef3e159cffb4ba6f0a228ab4
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

commit_message:
base: set $contentdir for CentOS

CentOS recently started syncing alternate arch repos to mirrors. And to
make it easier to play with centos-* packages idea of 'contentdir'
appeared.

https://lists.centos.org/pipermail/centos-devel/2018-March/016542.html

Change-Id: Ieb26c0aa65ba3ec1a45a33f87f670e5ecb782f82
(cherry picked from commit ec5daaaa634351d24706e605c2c6726be402d35b)

[{'created': '2018-05-02 19:00:45.000000000', 'message': 'Use latest puppet5 repos

This change makes sure the latest puppet5 version
is used when running integration jobs for puppet5.

The puppetlabs yum mirror is ready to be used and
has the proper packages and is mirrored, example:

* http://mirror.mtl01.inap.openstack.org/yum-puppetlabs/puppet5/

For the puppetlabs apt mirror the puppet5 pool is
needed before this will work. A patch has been fixed
for that here [1]. Therefore this change cannot be
merged until [1] is merged.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565867/

Change-Id: I1a2716fdd4b960b12ff24303038bec5ea8fb80a3

is used when running integration jobs for puppet5.

The puppetlabs yum mirror is ready to be used and
has the proper packages and is mirrored, example:

For the puppetlabs apt mirror the puppet5 pool is

commit_message:
Use latest puppet5 repos

This change makes sure the latest puppet5 version
is used when running integration jobs for puppet5.

The puppetlabs yum mirror is ready to be used and
has the proper packages and is mirrored, example:

* http://mirror.mtl01.inap.openstack.org/yum-puppetlabs/puppet5/

For the puppetlabs apt mirror the puppet5 pool is
needed before this will work. A patch has been fixed
for that here [1]. Therefore this change cannot be
merged until [1] is merged.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565867/

Change-Id: I1a2716fdd4b960b12ff24303038bec5ea8fb80a3

subject: Update ceph-osd-check-udev to correct an awk condition
messages: [{'account_id': 19564, 'date': '2018-05-09 19:17:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-05-10 19:47:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-05-14 20:18:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 19:17:27.000000000', 'message': "Update ceph-osd-check-udev to correct an awk condition

The awk statement will print 1 if the ceph release it < 0.94.
Otherwise, it will print nothing. When it does not print anything,
no value is set to DISABLE_UDEV. This results in the test failing.

++ ceph --version
++ awk 'match($3, /[0-9]+\.[0-9]+/) {if (substr($3, RSTART, RLENGTH) <= 0.94) {print 1}}'
+ DISABLE_UDEV=
+ test -f /usr/lib/udev/rules.d/95-ceph-osd.rules
+ test -eq 1
sh: line 3: test: -eq: unary operator expected

This patch adds a 'else { print 0 }' if the substr does not return true.

++ ceph --version
++ awk 'match($3, /[0-9]+\.[0-9]+/) {if (substr($3, RSTART, RLENGTH) <= 0.94) {print 1} else { print 0 } }'
+ DISABLE_UDEV=0
+ test -f /usr/lib/udev/rules.d/95-ceph-osd.rules
+ test 0 -eq 1

Change-Id: I4d2da48717c57b0d8d853d9e2a711ca02b18c6e1
(cherry picked from commit f3f166935b484683ba352f81dd7488f0e5ab53de)
"}]
commit_message:
Update ceph-osd-check-udev to correct an awk condition

The awk statement will print 1 if the ceph release it < 0.94.
Otherwise, it will print nothing. When it does not print anything,
no value is set to DISABLE_UDEV. This results in the test failing.

++ ceph --version
++ awk 'match($3, /[0-9]+\.[0-9]+/) {if (substr($3, RSTART, RLENGTH) <= 0.94) {print 1}}'
+ DISABLE_UDEV=
+ test -f /usr/lib/udev/rules.d/95-ceph-osd.rules
+ test -eq 1
sh: line 3: test: -eq: unary operator expected

This patch adds a 'else { print 0 }' if the substr does not return true.

++ ceph --version
++ awk 'match($3, /[0-9]+\.[0-9]+/) {if (substr($3, RSTART, RLENGTH) <= 0.94) {print 1} else { print 0 } }'
+ DISABLE_UDEV=0
+ test -f /usr/lib/udev/rules.d/95-ceph-osd.rules
+ test 0 -eq 1

Change-Id: I4d2da48717c57b0d8d853d9e2a711ca02b18c6e1
(cherry picked from commit f3f166935b484683ba352f81dd7488f0e5ab53de)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-07 15:54:00.000000000', 'message': "Add waiters to Nova tests to prevent tearDown failures

'test_rescue_server' and 'test_unrescue_server' consistently cause
tearDownClass failures with the following failure message:

'Resource <server_uuid> failed to delete and is in ERROR status'

By adding waiters, this issue is mitigated.

Change-Id: Ia1d9e1e07370f5c1e4c86f14d96c342f9c41a817
"}]
commit_message:
Add waiters to Nova tests to prevent tearDown failures

'test_rescue_server' and 'test_unrescue_server' consistently cause
tearDownClass failures with the following failure message:

'Resource <server_uuid> failed to delete and is in ERROR status'

By adding waiters, this issue is mitigated.

Change-Id: Ia1d9e1e07370f5c1e4c86f14d96c342f9c41a817

commit_message:
Create or attach interface should use specific network

In deployments with multiple networks, tests that create or attach an interface
will fail for the following reason:

"Multiple possible networks found, use a Network ID to be more specific."

To fix this, the tests should use the network created in the resource_setup

Change-Id: I10dc91252244fe05b513891ee8871965d398d351

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 20:28:26.000000000', 'message': "Make the networkd role distro agnostic

To make this role distro agnostic all of the variable configs have
been moved into defaults which will source private variables when
available using distro specific configs. This change will make it
possible to run this role on any distro, even if there's no distro
specific variable files.

Change-Id: I547edd2052c7e136b79d99e1b8e75e3aee68689d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Make the networkd role distro agnostic

To make this role distro agnostic all of the variable configs have
been moved into defaults which will source private variables when
available using distro specific configs. This change will make it
possible to run this role on any distro, even if there's no distro
specific variable files.

Change-Id: I547edd2052c7e136b79d99e1b8e75e3aee68689d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-08-23 09:16:31.000000000', 'message': "Switch to admin_token auth for standalone mode

Currently, during the client construction, if only os_auth_token
and endpoint arguments are passed, custom HTTPClient class based
on requests' sessions is used. This is unnecessary, as there is
admin_token auth type in keystoneauth that does basically the same,
eliminating the need for our custom implementation. Let's use it
instead and deprecate HTTPClient.

Change-Id: Ifc7b45d047c8882a41021e1604b74d17eac2e6e8

and endpoint arguments are passed, custom HTTPClient class based

instead and deprecate HTTPClient.

"}, {'created': '2017-08-09 11:45:44.000000000', 'message': "Switch to none auth for standalone mode

Currently, during the ironic shell client construction, if only
os_auth_token and endpoint arguments are passed, custom
HTTPClient class based on requests' sessions is used. This is
unnecessary, as there is admin_token auth type in keystoneauth
that does basically the same, eliminating the need for our
custom implementation. Apart from that, there is a none auth,
which requires only passing the desired endpoint to use, so we
can use it too without having to specify fake token strings
anymore. Let's use these auth methods instead and deprecate
HTTPClient.

Also this patch deprecates a bunch of arguments to client.get_client
function, changing them to the standard keystoneauth naming.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1696791

commit_message:
Switch to none auth for standalone mode

Currently, during the ironic shell client construction, if only
os_auth_token and endpoint arguments are passed, custom
HTTPClient class based on requests' sessions is used. This is
unnecessary, as there is admin_token auth type in keystoneauth
that does basically the same, eliminating the need for our
custom implementation. Apart from that, there is a none auth,
which requires only passing the desired endpoint to use, so we
can use it too without having to specify fake token strings
anymore. Let's use these auth methods instead and deprecate
HTTPClient.

Also this patch deprecates a bunch of arguments to client.get_client
function, changing them to the standard keystoneauth naming.

DocImpact
Story: 1696791
Task:  11836
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/559116
Change-Id: Ifc7b45d047c8882a41021e1604b74d17eac2e6e8

commit_message:
Annotate sort_key parameters for some resources

Add a 'is_sort_key' keyword for each attribute that can
be used as a sort_key. In the future, we will rely on this keyword
to perform validation: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554368/ .

This patch processes the following resources: flavors, logging, metering,
qos related resources. In addition, this patch processes the attributes that
are documented as sort_key in api-ref.

Change-Id: I845209e657bc0aee923a9bd316fded64c285a186
Related-Bug: #1749820

commit_message:
Annotate filter parameters for some resources

Add a 'is_filter' keyword for each resource's attribute that can be
used as filter. In the future, we will rely on this to perform
filter validation: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554368/ .

This patch processes the following resources: agents, availability zones,
flavors, log, metering, qos related resources. In addition, this patch
processes the attributes that are documented as filter parameter in api-ref.

Change-Id: I6f3feaeb61aa30fc4e18c440658f204344463ed2
Related-Bug: #1749820

Change-Id: Ie4bca80d0dba7b0da0b5829b91cd6d815894aeaa
'}, {'created': '2018-05-09 16:35:17.000000000', 'message': "Add Bionic testing

Now that bionic testing is added into the tests repos, we can
start testing it in the repo.

cgmanager isn't in bionic, and therefore is removed

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566959/
Change-Id: Ie4bca80d0dba7b0da0b5829b91cd6d815894aeaa
"}, {'created': '2018-05-10 17:57:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add Bionic testing

Now that bionic testing is added into the tests repos, we can
start testing it in the repo.

cgmanager isn't in bionic, and therefore is removed

The service module isn't in bionic, and therefore it's been renamed to
"systemd".

The apparmor setup we were doing was breaking the apparmor profiles
required. While this worked in xenial it breaks bionic. To fix this
we're just disabling the apparmor profiles instead of trying to to
augment them through block file changes.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566959/
Change-Id: Ie4bca80d0dba7b0da0b5829b91cd6d815894aeaa
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add Bionic testing

Now that bionic testing is added into the tests repos, we can
start testing it in the repo.

cgmanager isn't in bionic, and therefore is removed

The service module isn't in bionic, and therefore it's been renamed to
"systemd".

The apparmor setup we were doing was breaking the apparmor profiles
required. While this worked in xenial it breaks bionic. To fix this
we're just disabling the apparmor profiles instead of trying to to
augment them through block file changes.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566959/
Change-Id: Ie4bca80d0dba7b0da0b5829b91cd6d815894aeaa
Co-Authored-By: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add cleanup process when using embedded ansible

When using the embedded ansible the deactivation process will now
cleanup after itself.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add Bionic testing

Now that bionic testing is added into the tests repos, we can
start testing it in the repo.

This removes UCA from the list of sources for Bionic, as
Rocky 16.04 will be with Queens UCA, and Rocky 18.04 will
have no UCA, only base packages.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566959/
Change-Id: I7e6abf3c2f7a16ce79e934f9b9ff66bea89e6d67

commit_message:
Make resource requires a set instead of a list

Since we are doing set operations on it, make the 'requires' attribute of a
Resource a set and only convert to/from a list when loading/storing. To
avoid churn in the database, sort the list when storing it.

Change-Id: I137fae8ae630eb235d7811fcba81738d828e6a1e

commit_message:
Create replacement resources with correct requires

When we create a replacement resource, do so with the correct requires list
that it will ultimately have, instead of a copy of the old resource's
requires.

This will happen anyway when Resource.create_convergence() is actually
called (which is on the other end of an RPC message, so it may not actually
happen if another transition starts), but this makes it consistent from the
start.

Change-Id: Idf75a55be8d75e55c893ec1fb6ee3704f46bdc4f

commit_message:
Add Bionic testing

Now that bionic testing is added into the tests repos, we can
start testing it in the repo.

The /etc/apt/sources.list.d/ is not created in all the bionic
images, so we ensure it is created before using it.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566959/
Change-Id: I05c1bc8a0413dbb88514905b6fdf33304829484f

commit_message:
Enforce usage of oslo.context's project_id

Instead of using "project" which came from our legacy custom context
class, we enforce the usage of oslo.context's project_id. Thus cleaning
up that class a little bit.

Change-Id: Ic030f426de744c585ca6b4a02f0a9e6b6df15cc5

commit_message:
Fix for the manila-vmax configuration error

Fixing the manila configuration when using
manila-backend-vmax.yaml template due to malformed
emc_shared_backend hiera value

manila::backend::dellemc_vmax::share_backend_name will
be generically fixed for all backends in the
puppet-tripleo code

Change-Id: Ib43eede1bce8896ca14c9cea18c605bcb54c5b4d
Closes-Bug: #1771180

commit_message:
Update fullstack section in TESTING.rst

In order to run the fullstack tests correctly, you must
first run "export VENV=dsvm-fullstack" so that it does
some extra steps.  Added it to the TESTING.rst file and
updated some of the text in the fullstack section as well.

Change-Id: Iad2683dfc2d63fa23096d40c01000d8ac285176a

commit_message:
Heat: Add helm test

This PS adds helm test functionaility to heat. This test is taxing
om the oslo.db backend and can expose clustering issues effectively
when run with high concurrency.

Change-Id: I5d6074cedbc870b9536d85859381c3dba1ad4f61

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1063, 'name': 'Ed Leafe', 'email': 'ed@leafe.com', 'username': 'ed-leafe'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9708, 'name': 'Balazs Gibizer', 'display_name': 'gibi', 'email': 'gibizer@gmail.com', 'username': 'gibi'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14384, 'name': 'Quobyte CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci-external@quobyte.com', 'username': 'quobyteci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15941, 'name': 'DellEMC PowerFlex CI', 'email': 'emc.scaleio.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-scaleio-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23498, 'name': 'IBM zVM CI', 'email': 'zvmosci@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'zvmosci'}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-05-10 18:47:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-05-10 19:25:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I had an old car with an oil leak, and the warning light kept coming on. So I disconnected the bulb, and that took care of the warning.

That's what this feels like. Instead of addressing the problem, which is trying to store records with identical values for a unique column by hacking at the value of one of them, let's just silence the warning. It would be cleaner to simply remove the unique constraint, since our functional design calls for duplicate values to exist in that column when mapping instances. IOW, if we are deliberately putting in duplicate values, the column should not be defined as unique."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-05-10 20:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-18272 : FAILURE in 1h 07m 37s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-05-10 21:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/567669/1/ : FAILURE in 2h 17m 07s'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-05-10 21:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I had an old car with an oil leak, and the warning light kept
 > coming on. So I disconnected the bulb, and that took care of the
 > warning.

I think a better analogy would be a poorly designed car that had an oil sensor with no hysteresis. When you corner hard, the oil light comes on. You know it's not low on oil, it's just alerting you to something that doesn't matter. You could leave the bulb in so that if it goes off under other conditions you can do something about it, or you can remove it so it doesn't keep annoying you. I think we're discussing this because some people are in the latter category: they don't like four warnings during unit tests.

 > That's what this feels like. Instead of addressing the problem,
 > which is trying to store records with identical values for a unique
 > column by hacking at the value of one of them, let's just silence
 > the warning. It would be cleaner to simply remove the unique
 > constraint, since our functional design calls for duplicate values
 > to exist in that column when mapping instances. IOW, if we are
 > deliberately putting in duplicate values, the column should not be
 > defined as unique.

Well, the column is not "unique uuid" it's "unique string". I don't think removing the uniqueness constraint is what we want, because if we store uuids in there in the 8-4-4-4-12 format, we want the DB to kick it back for us.

This discussion spawned another way to solve this which is even less code/change. We could avoid using the object for the low-level database manipulation of the marker. That way we'd never load a ill-formatted value into the object field, and can keep the object field as it is for future warnings.

I know you don't like any of this approach, but do you like that better than this and/or better than just dealing with the warnings?'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-05-11 18:24:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> like that better

It just seems like another hack to get around the fact that we need to store the marker. We should either a) remove the unique constraint on the uuid column, or b) reversibly mutate the marker value, or c) add a boolean column that we can set to True for just the record that was last processed, or d) store the marker value somewhere else, such as a separate table. I've listed them in the order of preference, with a) and b) much better than c) or d). But IMO they are all preferable to any of the workaround hacks that exist or have been proposed."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-05-14 09:15:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > like that better
 > 
 > It just seems like another hack to get around the fact that we need
 > to store the marker. We should either a) remove the unique
 > constraint on the uuid column, or b) reversibly mutate the marker
 > value, or c) add a boolean column that we can set to True for just
 > the record that was last processed, or d) store the marker value
 > somewhere else, such as a separate table. I've listed them in the
 > order of preference, with a) and b) much better than c) or d). But
 > IMO they are all preferable to any of the workaround hacks that
 > exist or have been proposed.

How do you feel about storing the marker UUID in the project_id field in the form of INSTANCE_MIGRATION_MARKER-<UUID> ?
Pro:
* project_id is already a string field so this data would fit there
* don't need to change the field type of the InstanceMapping.instance_uuid. It is not nullable so we have to store something here for the marker object. The 00000000-0000-0000-0000-00000000 value could be used there.
Cons:
* If there is an ongoing mapping (i.e. there is a marker in the database with the current format) when the deployer upgrades to the proposed new code then we need to make sure that the new code understand the old marker."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-05-14 09:43:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > > like that better
 > >
 > > It just seems like another hack to get around the fact that we
 > need
 > > to store the marker. We should either a) remove the unique
 > > constraint on the uuid column, or b) reversibly mutate the marker
 > > value, or c) add a boolean column that we can set to True for
 > just
 > > the record that was last processed, or d) store the marker value
 > > somewhere else, such as a separate table. I've listed them in the
 > > order of preference, with a) and b) much better than c) or d).
 > But
 > > IMO they are all preferable to any of the workaround hacks that
 > > exist or have been proposed.
 > 
 > How do you feel about storing the marker UUID in the project_id
 > field in the form of INSTANCE_MIGRATION_MARKER-<UUID> ?
 >
 > Pro:
 > * project_id is already a string field so this data would fit there
 > * don't need to change the field type of the InstanceMapping.instance_uuid.
 > It is not nullable so we have to store something here for the
 > marker object. The 00000000-0000-0000-0000-00000000 value could be
 > used there.
 >
 > Cons:
 > * If there is an ongoing mapping (i.e. there is a marker in the
 > database with the current format) when the deployer upgrades to the
 > proposed new code then we need to make sure that the new code
 > understand the old marker.

Reading Dan's mail on the ML over again convinced me that the above Cons is too big of a problem to worth the effort fixing it properly for just 3 warning in the unit test."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-05-14 11:20:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

While the actual fix is debated here I proposed to suppress the warnings in a separate patch. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568263

Cheers,
gibi'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-05-14 18:16:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Squashing the warnings in the tests is more than enough to resolve this issue, IMHO'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-10 18:47:02.000000000', 'message': "Change the field type of InstanceMapping.instance_uuid

The InstanceMapping.instance_uuid field is currently a UUIDField, which in
oslo.versioned_objects is actually just a string field that requires a
strict opinionated formatting of 8-4-4-4-12. In nova-manage, we use a different
representation when setting the instance mapping marker to work around the
fact that we have a unique constraint on the column (unique string, indifferent
to the UUIDness we impart on it).

When we do this, the oslo library generates a warning about the formatting, which
is undesirable for test runs. Since we're already storing values in this object
field that don't meet the required formatting, this patch changes that field to
a bare StringField, and keeps the version at 1.0. This is okay because we're not
changing the format of the object on the wire (it is actually never serialized
anyway), and because we're not changing anything that would prevent older code
from serializing it (if we ever did). Doing so eliminates the warning and makes
the field definition line up with how we are using it.

Note that it has also been asserted that the marker we use for map_instances may
show up in certain APIs, although I do not understand how that could happen.
However, this patch also adds a filter to the only InstanceMappingList query that
could return it, ensuring that we do not.

Change-Id: I4625e64a53acd776356de5b0b40d4faef9dc343a
"}]
commit_message:
Change the field type of InstanceMapping.instance_uuid

The InstanceMapping.instance_uuid field is currently a UUIDField, which in
oslo.versioned_objects is actually just a string field that requires a
strict opinionated formatting of 8-4-4-4-12. In nova-manage, we use a different
representation when setting the instance mapping marker to work around the
fact that we have a unique constraint on the column (unique string, indifferent
to the UUIDness we impart on it).

When we do this, the oslo library generates a warning about the formatting, which
is undesirable for test runs. Since we're already storing values in this object
field that don't meet the required formatting, this patch changes that field to
a bare StringField, and keeps the version at 1.0. This is okay because we're not
changing the format of the object on the wire (it is actually never serialized
anyway), and because we're not changing anything that would prevent older code
from serializing it (if we ever did). Doing so eliminates the warning and makes
the field definition line up with how we are using it.

Note that it has also been asserted that the marker we use for map_instances may
show up in certain APIs, although I do not understand how that could happen.
However, this patch also adds a filter to the only InstanceMappingList query that
could return it, ensuring that we do not.

Change-Id: I4625e64a53acd776356de5b0b40d4faef9dc343a

commit_message:
EXPERIMENTAL: Name VOpts with more of the instance UUID

To further reduce the probability of name collisions, use the full
instance UUID as the name of the config drive (virtual optical media).

This is experimental.

Change-Id: I11f487fcc6e38d363ae4fddc7358d9c98dc4ace1

commit_message:
base: set $contentdir for CentOS

CentOS recently started syncing alternate arch repos to mirrors. And to
make it easier to play with centos-* packages idea of 'contentdir'
appeared.

https://lists.centos.org/pipermail/centos-devel/2018-March/016542.html

Depends-On: I0456040255bb9aa9091f1fb35e7d6960b8a36f9a

Change-Id: Ieb26c0aa65ba3ec1a45a33f87f670e5ecb782f82
(cherry picked from commit ec5daaaa634351d24706e605c2c6726be402d35b)

subject: Django 2.0 support
messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-05-10 14:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-05-14 07:38:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nThanks!'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-05-14 17:43:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-10 14:12:14.000000000', 'message': 'Django 2.0 support

Replace django.core.urlresolves with django.urls

(In Django 2.0) The django.core.urlresolvers module is removed
in favor of its new location, django.urls.
It was deprecated in Django 1.10:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/1.10/#id3

Add py35dj20 job to test Django 2.0 integration.
Also drops older Django unit tests from tox.ini
as horizon dropped Django <=1.10 support in Rocky.

Change-Id: I099c7b019c930307d3aae64b1729d6f532fc1653
'}]
commit_message:
Django 2.0 support

Replace django.core.urlresolves with django.urls

(In Django 2.0) The django.core.urlresolvers module is removed
in favor of its new location, django.urls.
It was deprecated in Django 1.10:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/1.10/#id3

Add py35dj20 job to test Django 2.0 integration.
Also drops older Django unit tests from tox.ini
as horizon dropped Django <=1.10 support in Rocky.

Change-Id: I099c7b019c930307d3aae64b1729d6f532fc1653

commit_message:
Collect tempest logs in CI from /var/log/tempest

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566364/ enables logging for tempest
  in /var/log/tempest. It will be helpful to collect logs in CI
  where tempest is runned using container.

Change-Id: Idc94ae6be7774be36c229400e2ccd347115e30ac

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: I46b543f91f14deb56be424b12ab038b46862e4f4

subject: Ensure interface ordering is consistent
messages: [{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-05-14 15:50:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-05-14 16:29:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 15:50:13.000000000', 'message': "Ensure interface ordering is consistent

This change adds a sort to the interface craetion process which will
key off the interface name and ensure we're not creating duplication
devices while also maintaining the sort order.

Change-Id: Iccedce916af0bcc6323b448229cd8958de40778c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure interface ordering is consistent

This change adds a sort to the interface craetion process which will
key off the interface name and ensure we're not creating duplication
devices while also maintaining the sort order.

Change-Id: Iccedce916af0bcc6323b448229cd8958de40778c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Add mount options for better machinectl performance
messages: [{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-05-14 14:35:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-05-14 16:29:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 14:35:05.000000000', 'message': 'Add mount options for better machinectl performance

The machinectl default options, while functional, could be tuned for
better overall performance. This change adds several options which will
ensure container workloads are using the lest amount of storage with the
best possible performance.

For more information on the options being used see
 * https://btrfs.wiki.kernel.org/index.php/Manpage/btrfs(5)#MOUNT_OPTIONS

Change-Id: I4f0a6f2ad5a96ff91b8efafba78236af653f5925
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add mount options for better machinectl performance

The machinectl default options, while functional, could be tuned for
better overall performance. This change adds several options which will
ensure container workloads are using the lest amount of storage with the
best possible performance.

For more information on the options being used see
 * https://btrfs.wiki.kernel.org/index.php/Manpage/btrfs(5)#MOUNT_OPTIONS

Change-Id: I4f0a6f2ad5a96ff91b8efafba78236af653f5925
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-05-14 15:10:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-05-14 15:12:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-05-14 15:13:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-05-14 16:31:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

The ldappool is not actively maintained and sometimes goes an entire
release without much change. It's probably time to consider moving
this to the independent release model instead of
cycle-with-intermediary.

Change-Id: I985eb99fb36b59da253f251f2f56fb1e2732534e
"}, {'created': '2018-05-14 15:12:10.000000000', 'message': "Move ldappool to _independent releases

release without much change. It's probably time to consider moving
this to the independent release model instead of

Change-Id: I985eb99fb36b59da253f251f2f56fb1e2732534e

commit_message:
Move ldappool to _independent releases

The ldappool is not actively maintained and sometimes goes an entire
release without much change. It's probably time to consider moving
this to the independent release model instead of
cycle-with-intermediary.

Change-Id: I985eb99fb36b59da253f251f2f56fb1e2732534e

commit_message:
Setup /dev/random and /dev/urandom device in cache prep (ubuntu/suse)

In the cache preparation stage, there are certain libraries that
depend on the existance of /dev/random and /dev/urandom in order
to be able to function correctly, such as NSS in the latest CentOS
release (7.5)

This patch adds those nodes so that the libraries are able to use
them with no problems, allowing yum and rpm specifically to work
properly again.

This was done for all distributions in [1], but the backports only
did it for RedHat.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/567585

Change-Id: Ib59aad2f2577d2f67c3ca6dc4ec20cfadd8ee960

commit_message:
apparmor: Misc fixes for lbaasv2 profile

Ensure that profiles are correctly applied in network
namespace using profile flag.

Allow lbaasv2 agent binary to read /proc/*/stat to support
monitoring of haproxy instances.

Change-Id: Ifc3388e894db998bfad8e5998a02120222d9e3ae
Closes-Bug: 1770040

commit_message:
Gate: Disable local nameserver

disable the local nameserver as it interferes with the k8s
dns-service and other local resolvers used for development use.

Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: I6c8524cef3de000dfed4394089f356684db47691
(cherry picked from commit dac707c96ba285be8fbe8712175b2ab8673d32fa)

Oh, I‚Äôm wrong on the SIGTERM, the process exit immediately.
But there is an issue by current approach, the shutdown doesn‚Äôt conform with the signature of a signal handler, and will raise exception, actually it‚Äôs L190 gets executed so that can work.
I suggest we add a signal handler and raise an exception there.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-04-26 19:29:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-04-26 19:37:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks Kaifeng!'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-04-27 03:30:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-04-27 03:54:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

thanks!'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-04-30 11:33:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-05-02 17:47:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Could you please update the commit message with the explanation how it works? I don't quite get why an exception in the signal handler ends up doing what you expect it to do."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-05-02 18:11:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Could you please update the commit message with the explanation how
 > it works? I don't quite get why an exception in the signal handler
 > ends up doing what you expect it to do.

Agreed, it's a bit strange.

When the Exception is raised the code in L190 catches the exception and calls the shutdown method. If I call the shutdown method directly it does not work because the shutdown method doesn‚Äôt conform with the signature of a signal handler.

I wonder if it would be better to change the shutdown method to something like below instead? And just call shutdown when receiving the signal.
   def shutdown(self, error=None, *args)"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-05-04 23:03:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-05-04 23:06:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

For reference. The full backtrace of the AssertionError mentioned in the commit message.

ironic_inspector.wsgi_service Traceback (most recent call last):
ironic_inspector.wsgi_service   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ironic_inspector/wsgi_service.py", line 157, in shutdown
ironic_inspector.wsgi_service     self._periodics_worker.wait()
ironic_inspector.wsgi_service   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/futurist/periodics.py", line 931, in wait
ironic_inspector.wsgi_service     self._dead.wait(timeout)
ironic_inspector.wsgi_service   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/threading.py", line 622, in wait
ironic_inspector.wsgi_service     self.__cond.wait(timeout, balancing)
ironic_inspector.wsgi_service   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/threading.py", line 339, in wait
ironic_inspector.wsgi_service     waiter.acquire()
ironic_inspector.wsgi_service   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/eventlet/semaphore.py", line 115, in acquire
ironic_inspector.wsgi_service     hubs.get_hub().switch()
ironic_inspector.wsgi_service   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/eventlet/hubs/hub.py", line 280, in switch
ironic_inspector.wsgi_service     assert cur is not self.greenlet, 'Cannot switch to MAINLOOP from MAINLOOP'
ironic_inspector.wsgi_service AssertionError: Cannot switch to MAINLOOP from MAINLOOP'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-07 13:39:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-05-07 18:14:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Okay, so I think I understand what concerns me about this patch. This code makes any instruction that was executed when the signal arrives to raise this Exception. Most of the time it will be inside the eventlet's main loop, so it works as expected. However, there is nothing preventing it to happen in the middle of e.g. introspection processing, which will result in the exception raised somewhere there. Am I missing something? Do you think we can avoid this problem?

What if we change Exception on https://github.com/openstack/ironic-inspector/blob/master/ironic_inspector/wsgi_service.py#L189 to BaseException (incl. KeyboardInterrupt), will it make the situation better?"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-05-07 18:19:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Reading more, we do need to set up something as a SIGTERM handler, otherwise the process won't clean up. Just unclear what.."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-05-07 18:22:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

As a dirty (really) hack we can raise KeyboardInterrupt, which won't be catched by any 'except Exception' clauses. Not quite graceful shutdown, to be honest..

A real fix is probably to switch to oslo.service."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-05-09 19:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-05-09 19:21:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Thanks for the insight Dmitry. I have changed it to raise KeyboardInterrupt.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-05-11 17:16:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-05-12 19:06:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-05-12 19:07:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-05-14 09:09:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-14 13:16:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Raise KeyboardInterrupt on SIGTERM - Workaround

Catch SIGTERM signal and call the signal handler method.
The signal handler then raises KeyboardInterrupt. The
KeyboardInterrupt won't be caught by any 'except Exception'
clauses.

Without this the service does not stop periodic workers,
tear down pxe filters etc as it is supposed to on shutdown.

NOTE: Calling shutdown() directly from the signal handler
causes the below error. This is why the signal handler
raises KeyboardInterrupt.
 AssertionError: Cannot switch to MAINLOOP from MAINLOOP

Related-Bug: #1765700

Story: 2001890
Task: 14374
Change-Id: If0e24eae767b7806243fa4ae34fedb30ae9af25a

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.

Change-Id: I860a8776bb32e8e05abd914110ca8df24d869bd2

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: I860a8776bb32e8e05abd914110ca8df24d869bd2

commit_message:
Include nova check script during update/upgrade/ffwd

This change includes the play for preparing the nova check script
inside update/upgrade/fast forward tasks.

Change-Id: Ifb6613e43f1261927eee67680ee8bbdaac6f14c0
(cherry picked from commit 74c9afa5a4a4aedae8cf5d413828ab5411a7d21d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-08 21:36:46.000000000', 'message': "add support for Federated IDentity (FID) and WebSSO

* add support for relating with subordinate charms providing Service
Provider functionality via apache2 authentication modules;
* enable additional authentication methods on the keystone side to
accept parsed assertion data provided via apache2 authentication module
variables exported to WSGI environment;
* move https frontend and WSGI API apache config files to keystone
instead of relying on charm-helpers as modifications are needed there to
add IncludeOptional directives. openstack_https_frontend.conf is added
on purpose as ServerName cannot be correctly determined after ProxyPass
which results in TLS errors during SAML exchange process;
* add an additional relation to openstack-dashboard to provide URL
information necessary to trust 'origin' parameter in WebSSO URLs used by
horizon during the authentication process. Also add a context to render
the federation section that is used to render this information in
keystone.conf;

Subordinates can choose to use different apache2 authentication modules.
If those modules support vhost-level variables then multiple
subordinates for the same module can be used. For example,
mod_auth_mellon can be used multiple times in different vhosts to
protect federated token endpoints related to different identity provider
and protocol combinations).

Trusted dashboard relation could be used to provide dashboard origin URL
from a different site via cross-model relations.

Change-Id: I1ef623b0b0e2a9f68cec4be550965c5e15e5f561

commit_message:
add support for Federated IDentity (FID) and WebSSO

* add support for relating with subordinate charms providing Service
Provider functionality via apache2 authentication modules;
* enable additional authentication methods on the keystone side to
accept parsed assertion data provided via apache2 authentication module
variables exported to WSGI environment;
* move https frontend and WSGI API apache config files to keystone
instead of relying on charm-helpers as modifications are needed there to
add IncludeOptional directives. openstack_https_frontend.conf is added
on purpose as ServerName cannot be correctly determined after ProxyPass
which results in TLS errors during SAML exchange process;
* add an additional relation to openstack-dashboard to provide URL
information necessary to trust 'origin' parameter in WebSSO URLs used by
horizon during the authentication process. Also add a context to render
the federation section that is used to render this information in
keystone.conf;

Subordinates can choose to use different apache2 authentication modules.
If those modules support vhost-level variables then multiple
subordinates for the same module can be used. For example,
mod_auth_mellon can be used multiple times in different vhosts to
protect federated token endpoints related to different identity provider
and protocol combinations).

Trusted dashboard relation could be used to provide dashboard origin URL
from a different site via cross-model relations.

NOTE: this functionality will be triggered only on Ocata+ (inclusive)

Change-Id: I1ef623b0b0e2a9f68cec4be550965c5e15e5f561

commit_message:
Add a rule to prevent passwords to be logged

Lint rule to make sure no module argument looking like "password"
will get logged.

Change-Id: I180b77faf7aaab57d1c48fc993e43f08c4fb16f6
Closes-Bug: #1760878
(cherry picked from commit c00ecb858d238fbba26d64750740f94f5411bd06)

It seems to me that we're going from:
* fsck, remove journal, resize, re-add journal
to:
* fsck, remove joural, fsck (within the resize function), resize, re-add journal

Do we really need the second fsck?
Alternatively, should we put the removal / re-addition of the journal into the common function so all hypervisors behave the same?"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-03-19 12:55:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2018-03-19 19:54:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The gate jobs only just worked, and its late here so I will deal with this tomorrow.'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2018-04-05 22:19:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I got quite confused working out the correct check_exit_code behaviour from nova.virt.disk.api.resize2fs. Ultimately that came down to the original pre-privsep implementation being a bit confused:

diff --git a/nova/virt/disk/api.py b/nova/virt/disk/api.py
index a3ac3f2..04f8b93 100644
--- a/nova/virt/disk/api.py
+++ b/nova/virt/disk/api.py
@@ -121,20 +121,10 @@ def mkfs(os_type, fs_label, target, run_as_root=True, specified_fs=None):
 
 
 def resize2fs(image, check_exit_code=False, run_as_root=False):
-    try:
-        utils.execute('e2fsck',
-                      '-fp',
-                      image,
-                      check_exit_code=[0, 1, 2],
-                      run_as_root=run_as_root)
-    except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as exc:
-        LOG.debug("Checking the file system with e2fsck has failed, "
-                  "the resize will be aborted. (%s)", exc)
+    if run_as_root:
+        nova.privsep.fs.resize2fs(image, check_exit_code)
     else:
-        utils.execute('resize2fs',
-                      image,
-                      check_exit_code=check_exit_code,
-                      run_as_root=run_as_root)
+        nova.privsep.fs.unprivileged_resize2fs(image, check_exit_code)

Which I didn't notice during the refactor. Note how we take a check_exit_code kwarg with a default of False, and then ignore it for the e2fsck? We instead only use that flag for the resize.

I'll fix this code to be equivalent to what we did pre-privsep.'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2018-04-05 22:27:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-06 02:07:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/552242/9/ : SUCCESS in 2h 27m 44s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-06 13:33:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

Sorry for being OCD, but in the spirit of changing as little as possible - see inline.

This is couched in the fact that I know virtually nothing about e2fsck/resize2fs, so I don't know whether the behavior change you introduced is at all relevant from a functional standpoint."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2018-04-09 10:29:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> For reference, this broke image resizing - see the fix in
 > I0ad8e34808401ace9b85e1b937a542f4c4e61690 (Processutils doesn't
 > like None as a return code - we need to use [0])

Thanks for the heads up. I noticed that xenserver CI didn't vote on PS15 but it voted +1 on PS1-14, so unless the breaking code was new in PS15, we must have some missing test coverage in xenserver CI.

And am I understanding correctly that the new image handler patch you linked is the only way to fix snapshotting that this patch broke? There's no simpler fix-only patch we could do to fix the problem?"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-05-14 14:49:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

One of the snapshot tests passed xenserver CI on PS14, looking at run_tests.log [1]:

 tempest.api.compute.images.test_images_oneserver.ImagesOneServerTestJSON.test_create_delete_image [8.759762s] ... ok

[1] http://dd6b71949550285df7dc-dda4e480e005aaa13ec303551d2d8155.r49.cf1.rackcdn.com/42/552242/14/check/dsvm-tempest-neutron-network/6669c9b/logs/run_tests.log'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-05-14 14:58:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

I also see resize tests passing on PS14, for example:

 tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_actions.ServerActionsTestJSON.test_resize_server_confirm [57.876103s] ... ok

[1] http://dd6b71949550285df7dc-dda4e480e005aaa13ec303551d2d8155.r49.cf1.rackcdn.com/42/552242/14/check/dsvm-tempest-neutron-network/6669c9b/logs/run_tests.log'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2018-05-14 15:13:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

I believe that the Tempest tests for flavour resize are going from m1.nano to m1.micro - which are both set up by devstack, and both have root_gb=0.
This therefore skips the disk resize code entirely for all hypervisors
(posting to both patches for completeness)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-13 01:52:18.000000000', 'message': "Move xenapi disk resizing to privsep.

There are a couple of small side effects here:

 - we now use -p on the pre-resize e2fsck, not -y. This matches
   how libvirt operates.

 - we now do two e2fscks if you're resizing down, one before
   shrinking the filesystem and one before shrinking the image.
   That's not perfect, but it makes the code simpler and should
   be an uncommon code path.

Change-Id: I6c695c04ae586fec6adc354257638116277dda88
blueprint: hurrah-for-privsep

commit_message:
Move xenapi disk resizing to privsep.

The same pattern as the rest of the changes. This means that privsep now
needs to let you pass flags to e2fsck, which I don't love and will remove
in a later patch.

Change-Id: I6c695c04ae586fec6adc354257638116277dda88
blueprint: hurrah-for-privsep

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 12:35:35.000000000', 'message': "Fix leftovers after backup abort

When aborting a backup on any chunked driver we will be leaving chunks
in the backend without Cinder knowing so and with no way of deleting
them from Cinder.  In this case the only way to delete them is going to
the storage itself and deleting them manually.

Another issue that will happen if we are using a temporary resource for
the backup, be it a volume or a snapshot, is that it will not be cleaned
up and will be left for us to manually issue the delete through the
Cinder API.

The first issue is caused by the chunked driver's assumption that the
`refresh` method in an OVO will ignore the context's `read_deleted`
configuration and always read the record, which is not true.  And since
it doesn't work when the record is deleted there will be leftovers if
the status of the backup transitions to deleted during the processing of
a chunk.

The second issue is caused by the same thing, but in this case is when
the backup manager refreshes the backup OVO to know the temporary
resource it needs to clean up.

This patches fixes the incorrect behavior of the backup abort mechanism
to prevent leaving things behind.

Closes-Bug: #1746559
Change-Id: Idcfdbf815f404982d26618710a291054f19be736
(cherry picked from commit 4ff9e63707e2c4cf5869f28e3e86fd0606d2db9a)
(cherry picked from commit d65444ce7df88292581d0726f9eb633be2292287)
Conflicts:
	cinder/backup/chunkeddriver.py
"}]
commit_message:
Fix leftovers after backup abort

When aborting a backup on any chunked driver we will be leaving chunks
in the backend without Cinder knowing so and with no way of deleting
them from Cinder.  In this case the only way to delete them is going to
the storage itself and deleting them manually.

Another issue that will happen if we are using a temporary resource for
the backup, be it a volume or a snapshot, is that it will not be cleaned
up and will be left for us to manually issue the delete through the
Cinder API.

The first issue is caused by the chunked driver's assumption that the
`refresh` method in an OVO will ignore the context's `read_deleted`
configuration and always read the record, which is not true.  And since
it doesn't work when the record is deleted there will be leftovers if
the status of the backup transitions to deleted during the processing of
a chunk.

The second issue is caused by the same thing, but in this case is when
the backup manager refreshes the backup OVO to know the temporary
resource it needs to clean up.

This patches fixes the incorrect behavior of the backup abort mechanism
to prevent leaving things behind.

Closes-Bug: #1746559
Change-Id: Idcfdbf815f404982d26618710a291054f19be736
(cherry picked from commit 4ff9e63707e2c4cf5869f28e3e86fd0606d2db9a)
(cherry picked from commit d65444ce7df88292581d0726f9eb633be2292287)
Conflicts:
	cinder/backup/chunkeddriver.py

[{'created': '2017-07-28 05:01:24.000000000', 'message': "Make glance image uploads atomic in filesystem

This change makes the filesystem uploads appear atomic by
writing it to a temp file in filesystem data directory and then
moving it to its final destination in the same directory.

Introduces config variable 'write_to_temp_file' to indicate
whether temp file should be used for image uploads.

Change-Id: I6a88bd86dcec443ba16432d26d5e5082a4decbdb
Closes-Bug: #1297451

commit_message:
Make glance image uploads atomic in filesystem

This change makes the filesystem uploads appear atomic by
writing it to a temp file in filesystem data directory and then
moving it to its final destination in the same directory.

Introduces config variable 'write_to_temp_file' to indicate
whether temp file should be used for image uploads.

Change-Id: I6a88bd86dcec443ba16432d26d5e5082a4decbdb
Closes-Bug: #1297451

commit_message:
Update Makefile

Per [0], update Makefile to behave as it was before with an added
check(s) for the existence of a folder prior to processing.  This
allows us to reinstate the helm-toolkit folder even though it has
been migrated, and will build as usual if a developer has a helm-
toolkit in the directory.

Also, did some minor cleanup to the Makefile.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568177/1

Change-Id: I4e0a26b4a228d63a1c769d2f0c935fa3fc56192c
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Update .gitignore

This patchset adds "helm-toolkit" to .gitignore. As that folder has been
migrated to OSH-infra, this allows developers to conveniently symlink to
the folder in OSH-infra without the risk of checking such symlink into
this repository.

Change-Id: Idb475896625ab310812bf7043e020c0c2847156f
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
New project: metalsmith - simple deployment tool for bare metal

This is a small library/CLI tool to provision bare metals using Ironic,
Neutron and Glance. It has a simple scheduler and hides away most of
complexity when dealing with the provisioning process.

Metalsmith will not be an official project for the time being.

Change-Id: I734e109d8e821512bd502072b7d50bc0b363d8f8

commit_message:
Fix tenant DeprecationWarning from oslo_context

This removes a deprecation warning as a follow up for
Ie555a5c554356c04d929fce972b061f720701355.

Error:

DeprecationWarning: Using the 'tenant' argument is deprecated
in version '2.18' and will be removed in version '3.0',
please use the 'project_id' argument instead

Change-Id: I34236ea30b9a14b8c72495e738476272b56910ce

commit_message:
base/debian: use Linaro ERP 18.06 repository

At Linaro we are working on new release (based on Debian/stretch).

All packages used by Kolla got moved to release repo.

Change-Id: Id9aab125b2e5c7e66b4befadb435c697d8b2e553

subject: Ignore unexpected arguments to token auth plugin
messages:
[{'account_id': 21109, 'date': '2018-02-08 18:11:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-16 15:50:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I know this should be basically a noop but I'm a little unsure about it. Why do you have OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME set when you're trying to use this? I think I would rather expect ksa/osc to reject arguments it doesn't understand than to silently ignore them. Or I would expect osc to be in charge of dropping them, not ksa."}, {'account_id': 21109, 'date': '2018-02-16 16:32:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I know this should be basically a noop but I'm a little unsure
 > about it. Why do you have OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME set when you're
 > trying to use this? I think I would rather expect ksa/osc to reject
 > arguments it doesn't understand than to silently ignore them. Or I
 > would expect osc to be in charge of dropping them, not ksa.

In our environment we have all the credentials set in an openrc file that is then sourced it. This includes User and Project domain info, endpoint type, auth urls etc. 

During upgrades, we launch an instance of Keystone on our slave node, sync the Keystone database (which includes the service catalog) and then run Puppet manifest against this instance of Keystone to create user accounts for new services that got added in this Upgrading release (say Magnum / Ironic), so that those services come up properly after upgrades. Therefore we need to authenticate by TOKEN and Bypass URL since the service catalog entry (Keystone internal and URL endpoints) still point to the main Keystone running on the master node (that is running the old release) and we don't want to talk to it during upgrade.

This strategy worked fine for Kilo->Mitaka and Mitaka->Newton upgrades, We first hit this issue during Newton->Pike upgrades

Look at some of the other Plugins in Keystoneauth1 such as passwords, they seem to all be successfully ignoring arguments that they don't care about and that ignore/drop seems to be done in keystoneauth1 instead of osclient.

Infact, if we look at get_endpoint_data() within the token Plugin it too passes in kwargs to ignore arguments that it specifically doesn't care about."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-16 18:58:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> Look at some of the other Plugins in Keystoneauth1 such as
 > passwords, they seem to all be successfully ignoring arguments that
 > they don't care about and that ignore/drop seems to be done in
 > keystoneauth1 instead of osclient.
 > 
 > Infact, if we look at get_endpoint_data() within the token Plugin
 > it too passes in kwargs to ignore arguments that it specifically
 > doesn't care about.

So actually the constructors of these plugins almost never ignore kwargs. For all the classes inheriting from keystoneauth1.plugin.BaseAuthPlugin, these do not accept unknown kwargs:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystoneauth/tree/keystoneauth1/noauth.py?h=3.4.0#n23
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystoneauth/tree/keystoneauth1/service_token.py?h=3.4.0#n22
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystoneauth/tree/keystoneauth1/identity/base.py?h=3.4.0#n38
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystoneauth/tree/keystoneauth1/identity/v3/tokenless_auth.py?h=3.4.0#n32
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystoneauth/tree/keystoneauth1/identity/access.py?h=3.4.0#n33
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystoneauth/tree/keystoneauth1/identity/generic/base.py?h=3.4.0#n35
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystoneauth/tree/keystoneauth1/identity/v2.py?h=3.4.0#n37
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystoneauth/tree/keystoneauth1/identity/v3/base.py?h=3.4.0#n47

There are some that accept kwargs. In all those cases that I could find, they are not ignored, but passed to the parent constructor, and the parent never accepts unknown kwargs, so passing in garbage to these would still fail:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystoneauth/tree/keystoneauth1/identity/generic/password.py?h=3.4.0#n30
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystoneauth/tree/keystoneauth1/identity/v2.py?h=3.4.0#n112
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystoneauth/tree/keystoneauth1/identity/v2.py?h=3.4.0#n161
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystoneauth/tree/keystoneauth1/identity/v3/base.py?h=3.4.0#n108

This all has to do with the constructor that this patch changes, not get_endpoint_data(). Since all the other plugins are very strict about what they accept, I don't think making token_endpoint the odd plugin out is a good idea. I would rather get to the bottom of what changed between Mitaka and Pike that caused your workflow to break."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-03-19 17:26:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

++ to what Colleen highlighted. Please don't make one plugin the odd-one-out."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-05-14 14:22:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Administratively abandoning this change, we can restore if we need to revisit.'}]

[{'created': '2018-02-08 18:11:46.000000000', 'message': "Ignore unexpected arguments to token auth plugin

When using the token auth plugin, for authentication via token, extra
arguments might get passed in by the application that the auth plugin
doesn't care about. This will cause a TypeError due to unexpected

Change-Id: Ib576e47f088d969646d582c4131a5181a4a1323f

commit_message:
Ignore unexpected arguments to token auth plugin

When using the token auth plugin, for authentication via token, extra
arguments might get passed in by the application that the auth plugin
doesn't care about. This will cause a TypeError due to unexpected
keyword arguments. These extra arguments should just be ignored instead.

Change-Id: Ib576e47f088d969646d582c4131a5181a4a1323f
Closes-Bug: #1748252
Signed-off-by: Kam Nasim <kam.nasim@windriver.com>
